Title: Corvettes of the ADA type - what should the enemy be afraid of: about the powerful air defense syste...
Description: Stepan Yakymyak notes that these ships are the latest models of multi-purpose ships of the near sea zone, capable of successfully fighting air, surface and underwater enemies. Corvettes are designed with low-visibility technologies in mind, which can reduce the range of their detection by the enemy. Also, these corvettes have the necessary means of radio-electronic, anti-aircraft, anti-ship and anti-submarine defense. In addition, the ships are equipped with aviation systems that significantly increase the radius of combat influence, and a modern strike missile system for destroying surface targets. These are very successful decisions that significantly expand the strike capabilities of the ship and its contribution to the support of joint forces on land. An analysis of the tactical and technical characteristics of ADA-type corvettes, their main armament and tactical properties demonstrates the significant potential capabilities of these ships. The military expert focuses on the armament of the air defense systems of these corvettes. For example, the joint use of an anti-aircraft missile complex (with a firing range of up to 20 km), a 35-mm anti-aircraft artillery installation (with a firing range of up to 4 km) and two 12.7-mm machine guns should ensure sufficiently dense anti-aircraft defense of the ship. This will make it possible to effectively counter a group of air targets that the enemy is able to form from supersonic land-based, sea-based and air-based anti-ship missiles and attack UAVs. It is expected that the anti-aircraft missiles of the ship complex should destroy the supersonic anti-ship missiles of the Russian Federation. We are talking, in particular, about Onyx-type missiles, which are in the arsenal of Bastion-type coastal missile systems of the Russian Federation. We will remind, several times these missiles were unsuccessfully used by the enemy to hit coastal targets on the Odesa coast. Stepan Yakymyak explains that the presence of modern anti-submarine weapons on corvettes creates significant capabilities in the fight against Russian submarines. - It is assumed that the latest samples of anti-submarine weapons (hydroacoustic complex and torpedo weapons. - Ed.) will ensure the early detection and destruction of modern submarines. Even such as project 636.3, which are in the arsenal of the Russian Federation. Let me remind you that these boats, equipped with cruise missiles of the Kalibr complex, launch systematic missile attacks on objects on the territory of Ukraine. Our corvettes will be equipped with shock missile weapons. If the missile complex will have a range of 150-300 or more kilometers, it will enable our ships to destroy (hit) enemy surface targets at the same distance. This is very important today, because the Russians have a significant number of combat surface ships of the main classes. — Let's simulate the situation. The use of only one ammunition in the amount of 8 missiles under different conditions will allow hitting an average of two to four surface targets. That is, it will be possible to disable 1-2 tactical groups of enemy ships. A military expert says ADA-type corvettes have modern means of communication and a combat information and control system: - This can provide an advantage over the enemy not only in the promptness of decision-making and actions, but also in the so-called intellectual advantage. What tasks will the -Ivan Mazepa- and -Ivan Vyhovskyi- corvettes be able to perform in specific conditions, for example, in the Black and Mediterranean seas or other specified areas? First of all, Stepan Yakymyak recalled the views on the creation and tasks of corvettes for the national navy that existed until now. — As is known, the leadership and specialists of the Naval Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine throughout the entire recent history of the state provided relevant justifications and strove to have similar ships in the fleet. After all, in 2010, the national corvette of project 58250 was laid down in Mykolaiv. According to the Strategy of the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine 2035 (announced in 2018. — Ed.), it was planned to adopt a series of such corvettes during the second stage of fleet development, 2025-2030 . We will remind you that the Strategy was developed together with experts from NATO member countries, including the United States. Actually, corvettes can rely on two blocks of tasks: — If we analyze the hypothetical situation regarding the involvement of corvettes in actions in the conditions of the long war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, then it should be taken into account that the newly built ships are in the Sea of ​​Marmara. They cannot be included during the war in the Ukrainian group of forces operating in the Black Sea. Because according to the Montreux Convention, the Bosphorus Strait is closed to the passage of warships. It should not be forgotten, says a military expert, that Russian forces still have significant capabilities in the fight against surface ships. The enemy has enough power to strike surface targets. the rascals still have air superiority for now. The ratio in anti-ship weapons, i.e. symmetrical means of confrontation at sea and naval combat, is still not in favor of Ukraine. It is because of this that the Ukrainian Navy chose and implemented the concept of asymmetric actions in the war at sea: — Therefore, it would be logical to state that in the current conditions, the hypothetical use of new corvettes in the Black Sea against the enemy is not a rational option. Many domestic and foreign experts claim that in modern conditions, ADA-type corvettes can perform so-called coalition tasks. It is about involvement in joint tasks (exercises) with NATO forces outside the Black Sea: — We will not only demonstrate loyalty to common values, but also really strengthen the Alliance's groupings at sea. And this is in the conditions when significant resources of our partners are spent to ensure combat operations and the success of the Defense Forces of Ukraine in the protracted war with the enemy. Stepan Yakymyak emphasizes that the best option for using the newly built corvettes and minesweepers, which are currently based in Great Britain, is to practice joint tasks and exercises with NATO partners outside the Black Sea. — Of course, it should be taken into account that in the event of the deployment of corvettes in the Mediterranean Sea and other water areas, one can expect provocations and, perhaps, even sabotage actions on the part of the Russian Federation. At the same time, if corvettes perform joint tasks as part of NATO forces, the risk of such actions by the enemy will be much lower. The military expert emphasizes: in the future, all possible tasks of corvettes will necessarily take into account probable scenarios of actions and task performance with various units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine and will depend on the enemy's capabilities at sea. It is extremely important to emphasize that the corvettes must learn to act together in the general system of combat use of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. — In particular, with units equipped with coastal missile systems, fighter-bomber aircraft, primarily F-16, naval unmanned and unmanned aircraft systems, reconnaissance assets, in particular, NATO forces in the Black Sea. Therefore, in the opinion of Stepan Yakymyak, the likely prospective tasks of ADA-type corvettes are: If we talk about the Black Sea, then in the future, in the event of a crisis situation and a military conflict, corvettes can be effectively involved in the following tasks: — I emphasize, the effectiveness of actions corvettes in the Black Sea will largely depend on solving the problems of ensuring the stealth and combat stability of these ships. This is the key point. This is necessary, first of all, during the process of deploying corvettes to combat areas and during active hostilities. Further, of course, in the case of returning to the base points and the presence of ships there for recovery and replenishment of supplies.

Title: Under Stepov, he held his position for 5 hours by himself: the story of junior sergeant Volodymyr
Description: What's it like to hold a position all by yourself? And how do their commanders drive the Russians to attack? Junior sergeant Volodymyr told the ArmyInform correspondent about this. — In March of this year, we advanced to Pervomaiske, in the Donetsk region. We were in a Hummer. As soon as we entered the settlement, the enemy began to -cover- us. So the race was very difficult. We were driven to the evacuation point, and from there we had to walk about 200 meters to reach the school where our position was. These 200 meters became -the road of life- for us... They worked on us with both mines and dumps while we approached the school. And we already had one wounded person. We had to replace guys from the 59th brigade at the position. When we entered the school premises, our wounded man was stabilized. Of course, constant shelling of us began. And later, the enemy began to storm. And these assaults were constant, almost non-stop. In the end, the enemy did enter the school premises. The second and third floors of the building were almost empty at that time. Well, we started knocking out the enemy... That day we killed four in the school, another one on the way out. The sixth, most likely, was injured, but managed to escape. Although later we heard from intercepts that he was no longer communicating... We took four walkie-talkies from them. And, of course, they heard what they were transmitting. From the interceptions, it was understood when they would go on assaults. By the way, the enemy is being forced to advance, because none of them wants to go forward. And when they tried to enter the school again, they did not know that we had already put theirs in front of it. And they ask something on the radio, think that they are communicating with their own. We say -Zachody!- in Russian. Well, they also filled up those at the entrance. They all hit me with some kind of cologne... It was there in Pervomaiskyi, by the way, that I was wounded... We had to be changed, and there was a flight next to me. Everything flew out of my hands, I thought that the khan was already mine, but no - I survived. ...I still had a business trip to one of the mechanized brigades. In December 2023. Then we went into position near Stepovoy. This is also the Donetsk region. There were only five of us. They stormed us very hard. At that time, a boy was killed in a night battle. Later, after mortar shelling, one more of our soldiers died. And there were three of us left. Then two of them left under certain circumstances, and I was left to hold the position away by myself. It lasted for five hours. I was told that my sector was for 12 hours, that I was being covered from left to right, I had to hold the landing... Later, the command gave two people to help. They stayed until dusk, and then a group was sent to support me. Until morning we held our position under these enemy assaults, and then we were already replaced. Then I even lost count of how many enemy infantry we destroyed...

Title: Language inspectors in Frankivsk: propaganda twisted the words of the mayor and caused a scandal
Description: After checking the information at the Main Directorate of the National Police in the Ivano-Frankivsk Region, the Countering Disinformation Center notified, that not a single language-related crime has been committed in the city recently. Similar fakes are actively spread by Russian propaganda in order to create the illusion of a split in Ukrainian society around the language issue. It should be noted that the enemy managed to play the -language card- only in 2014. At that time, it was the disinformation campaign surrounding the status of the Russian language in Ukraine that helped the occupiers seize Crimea and certain areas of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions. On September 9, Ivano-Frankivsk Mayor Ruslan Martsinkiv discussed the public initiative -Language Inspectors-, which was immediately used by propaganda. The enemy spread a fake that communicating in Russian in Ukrainian cities would be severely punished. After that, the author of the initiative had to go into the public space and justify himself: not language inspectors, but public activists; they will not punish, but will promote the state one. Even Taras Kremin, the authorized person for the protection of the state language, had to intervene in the situation. -I want to warn against one big danger - there have never been and never will be any language inspectors in Ukraine. This is a pure invention of Russian propaganda, which since 2019, when the language law came into force, began to actively use the so-called semantic slurs, which they used to call our institution, calling me -Sprechen-Führer-, and representatives of the commissioner - language inspectors, punishers. This is one of the components of the information field from the point of view of Russian propaganda,- said Taras Kremin.

Title: Immersion in archeology: about an unusual way of military rehabilitation
Description: In the 12th century, monks started the first hospital center for soldiers here, which later turned into a separate monastery. And today, the -Spiritual restoration through culture- program is being implemented in the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra National Reserve, the purpose of which is to provide moral and spiritual support to the defenders of Ukraine after the most difficult trials of the war through immersion in the cultural and historical space of the Lavra. We are talking about the program with the general director of the National Reserve -Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra- Maksym Ostapenko. — Maksym Anatoliyovych, for the military, especially after the injuries, it is very it is probably useful to immerse yourself in the cultural and historical space of the national shrine through communication, excursions, as well as prayer... — This program of spiritual restoration began its work in 2023. From the feedback we get from the military, — she really works. She has a very positive effect on the military because, actually, a person who is currently in the army, he should receive both psychological and moral support to a large extent. A military man must understand that he is not only saving his own family, his own house, fighting for his immediate environment, but also defending the independence of this state. When he gets to the Lavra, he understands that in this way he helps to protect Ukrainian shrines, which are no less important for the state than everything else that we have. After all, national shrines — are those things that cement any nation. And, unfortunately, Russia tried to take these shrines away from us during centuries For centuries, she tried to influence Ukrainians, our nation, our people through shrines. And now, the military, who participate in studying and diving into these shrines, also feel like defenders of the national heritage. And this is very important, because in this way we combine here the cultural component, the spiritual component and at the same time the psychological rehabilitation of those soldiers who come here. In addition, Lavra herself — span> it is a place of prayer, a place of deep identity and culture that definitely inspires people. Many of those who attend this program are coming to the Lavra, or not for the first time. Few people even know how powerful and outstanding this place is, which has shaped our identity for a thousand years. And when people join these sanctuaries, this incredible territory, they feel a very serious moral upliftment. provision (complex of measures that are carried out with the aim of forming, maintaining and restoring the moral and psychological state of the personnel of the troops (forces) necessary for the successful performance of assigned tasks. — Author). It seems to me that visiting such objects — is exactly what is called moral and psychological support in its purest form. — You recently took part in a workshop in the UK called 'Using Archeology for Restoration'. The main topic of the meeting was the development of methods of psychological rehabilitation and support for combatants and veterans. Tell us more about this meeting. — In June of this year, together with an employee of the reserve, head of the research department of archeology Serhiy Taranenko, we attended a seminar at the invitation of Bournemouth University in Great Britain. devoted to the rehabilitation of military personnel through participation in archaeological excavations. The seminar was attended by six groups engaged in such rehabilitation. One of them was our team. We talked about the experience that has already been implemented during the year in the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra, and specialists from Bournemouth University, the Ministry of Defense of Great Britain and several other British universities talked about the experience of involving veterans, military personnel in rehabilitation through immersion in archeology. In Great Britain, the Nightingale program has been operating for about 10 years under the leadership of the leading archaeologist of the Ministry of Defense, Richard Osgood. This is a very interesting program that involves the involvement of veterans and improving their psychological state after participating in hostilities through involvement in archeology. We plan to highlight and expand the archaeological component of our rehabilitation program. The British experience showed us how important it is to organize work with the military at the excavations, and we are ready to apply this knowledge in Ukraine. culture- regarding many points, we managed to achieve what they did for 10 years. After all, they are only now coming to understand that, in addition to archeology, it is necessary to look for the possibility of adding a historical and spiritual component. And the basis of our program is precisely the historical and spiritual component, and archeology was one of the components. We have slightly different starting positions, but the idea of ​​spiritual restoration through involvement in the study of one's own history — this has already become a practice that exists in Great Britain, and perhaps in other countries. It is very nice that Lavra was also able to share her experience, and I think that our experience will be used. Colleagues from universities who study precisely the psychological aspects of such programs were very interested in getting acquainted with our information. I am sure that these contacts and this program will continue to develop. We dream that the program developed in the National Reserve -Kyiv-Pecherska Lavra- together with the Antony and Fedosiy Pechersky Charitable Fund and the Ukrainian Lavra Charitable Fund with the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, so that this program will be scaled to other cultural locations of Ukraine . There are already offers from other museums and nature reserves to join similar events with the participation of the military. For cooperation within the framework of the -Spiritual restoration through culture- program, contact the following phone number: +38 (050) 974-22-46 (Oleg Topilko).

Title: They play the role of bait: the Armed Forces explained the extremely high level of enemy losses in t...
Description: Colonel Vitaly Sarantsev, the spokesman of Kharkiv OTU, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni- . Since the beginning of the offensive in Kharkiv Oblast in May, the occupiers have lost more than 16,000 soldiers. — This is actually the population of a small district center anywhere — whether in Russia or Ukraine. Of course, this is a lot, but the enemy does not count with his losses, he is not interested in the losses of his personnel. He prefers to keep equipment or some sort of weapon rather than his own personnel, the spokesman said. This attitude of the Russian command towards its own soldiers allows them to be used as bait or bait to identify the firing positions of units of the Defense Forces. - Very often people are sent by some incomprehensible storms. People are very often sent on assaults or offensives, using them simply as bait for the Defense Forces to start working on them. In this way, they try to find out our fire system and then inflict fire damage, he explained. At the same time, those Russian soldiers who play the role of bait have practically no chance of survival. - It should be noted that Russia has never won a war with military art or any experience. This is all the blood, flesh and life of our compatriots, Vitaliy Sarantsev noted. He thanked all defenders of Ukraine - representatives of all units and components of the Defense Forces - for effective combat work. The achieved result in the destruction of the enemy was achieved precisely by their joint concerted and coordinated efforts. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that since the beginning of the second offensive attempt in Kharkiv region, the enemy has lost more than 16 thousand soldiers - this is population of the district center.

Title: The searcher of the Ukrainian Air Defense Forces in Kharkiv was sentenced to eight years in prison
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informs about this. The court found the 59-year-old man guilty of justifying and denying the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, as well as of disseminating information about the location of the Armed Forces of Ukraine for the possibility of their identification in the locality, committed under martial law (parts 1, 2 of article 436 -2, part 2 of Article 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). He was sentenced to 8 years in prison with confiscation of property. Prosecutors proved that in September 2023, the Kharkiv resident -entered- Telegram channels controlled by Russian services. Through these groups, Russian curators -look for- agencies that are ready to cooperate with them. -The man made a conspiratorial photo and video recording of the consequences of Russian missile strikes on Kharkiv in order to further correct enemy fire. During this, he tried to fulfill the main task - to find air defense systems in the city to transmit information to the Russian special services. -He also leaked the location of Ukrainian servicemen, equipment and ammunition in the regional center to the specified chats,- the prosecutors added. In addition, on his own page in the social network -Facebook-, the Kharkiv native distributed posts in support of the Russian Federation and tried in every way to discredit the Ukrainian army. The person involved did not hide his pro-Russian views even in personal chats with acquaintances. During the search of the suspect's premises, a mobile phone with evidence of illegal activity was seized. The man from Kharkiv was waiting for the verdict while in custody. At the court hearing, he did not admit his guilt and refused to provide explanations pursuant to Art. 63 of the Constitution of Ukraine. As reported ArmyInform, members of a paramilitary formation that was preparing to seize power were exposed in Odessa.

Title: The equipment of the occupiers is Soviet junk, but the enemy makes it a combat unit
Description: However, due to the amount, it can bring results, so it is necessary to deprive Russia of the ability not only to produce, but also to remove from storage and put into service any military equipment and weapons. This was emphasized by the commander of the 92nd separate assault air defense battalion -Achilles- on the broadcast of the -Suspilne Novosti- marathon. Captain Yury Fedorenko of the brigade named after Ivan Sirk, the basket captain. — The adversary retains the ability to finance its military-industrial complex enterprises, which deconserve, repair and refit Soviet junk that is, one way or another, a combat unit capable of performing combat missions, he explained. In view of this, the enemy retains the ability to saturate the front line with a sufficient amount of armored vehicles. — Today, the enemy copes with this task. Therefore, the technique is used by him from the point of view of military expediency - where it is necessary to have a quick result, the enemy tries to use this technique more intensively. Where he was shot and he has no reserves, of course he will use other means, the military said. Therefore, the main task is to beat the occupier on its territory, destroying the enterprises of the military-industrial complex. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Kharkiv direction, the occupiers use outdated Soviet armored vehicles and mobilizovanyh-vyazniv/->throw newly mobilized prisoners to -meat assaults-.

Title: They organized the cruelest torture chamber in Kherson: a Russian general and 10 of his subordinates...
Description: About this informs September 23 SBU. -This time, the crimes of Major General of the Russian Police Yury Zavyalov, the deputy head of the main department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia in the Krasnoyarsk Territory, and his subordinates have been documented,- the report says. According to the case materials, at the request of Gauleiter Saldo in July 2022, the Kremlin -sent- them to Kherson, which was captured at that time, to carry out so-called -cleansing- among local residents. -For the organization of repressive measures, Zavyalov was appointed the head of the occupying -Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation in the Kherson region.- Two more Russian police colonels, Gennady Beryozin and Yuriy Zakavryashin, received the -deputy positions- of the head of the pseudo-institution, the SBU said. These three figures organized squads of Russians who abducted residents of the regional center and escorted them to the occupation torture chamber, which was run by Andrii Spivak, a 38-year-old senior lieutenant of the Russian police. -According to Zavyalov's orders, his subordinate subjected prisoners to cruel torture, including beatings and starving them,- the SBU said. As evidenced by the proceedings, it was on Spivak's order that the 54-year-old ATO veteran was electrocuted to death. During the liberation of Kherson, Zavyalov and his subordinates fled to the Russian Federation, where they received Kremlin awards. In order to hide war crimes, the profile data of the persons involved in the personal files in the Russian Federation were changed. However, such a conspiracy did not help them. SBU employees together with the National Police established the identities of each attacker and their personal data. So far, Zavyalov, Beryozin, Zakavryashin, Spivak and six other defendants have been notified in absentia of suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 28, Part 1 of Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violations of the laws and customs of war, committed by a group of persons following a prior conspiracy). The actions of another criminal are qualified under Part 2 of Art. 28, part 5 of Art. 27, Part 2 of Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (assistance in cruel treatment of the civilian population combined with intentional murder). -Comprehensive measures are underway to bring the guilty to justice. Each of the war criminals of the Russian Federation will be found and punished,- the SBU summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office in absentia >notified about the suspicion of a 45-year-old citizen of the Russian Federation for violation of the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder and committed by a group of persons based on a prior conspiracy.

Title: Artificial intelligence helps detect 12,000 enemy targets every week — MOU
Description: About this inform September 23 in the MOU. It is noted that such a result is achieved by automatic analysis of video from drones and stationary cameras. Thanks to the AI ​​platform, operators can make decisions faster and more efficiently, and the risk of errors due to fatigue is reduced. Such integration already works successfully in the VEZHA streaming module of the DELTA combat system. -The Avengers platform, developed by the Innovation Center of the Ministry of Defense, is unique in the world in terms of the volume of video data with enemy equipment. We continue to develop Avengers and other AI solutions to provide our military with an advantage,- said Kateryna Chernogorenko, Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine for Digitalization. According to her, MOU plans to expand the platform's cloud capabilities in the future, as well as integrate AI solutions for drones. The Innovation Center continues to train the AI ​​model of the Avengers platform on new data. This allows you to improve the quality of recognition of various enemy vehicles, even in difficult conditions, such as tanks hidden in forests or BMPs moving along dirt roads. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministry of Defense is planning to launch a new application Veteran+ /a>.

Earlier, ArmyInform showed -sniper- skid — how drones hit a Russian truck while driving.

Title: Coalitions of capabilities: 34 countries effectively support the defense of Ukraine
Description: The Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov told about this. -Within the Ramstein platform, we have created eight coalitions of capabilities, which include 34 member countries of the Contact Group on Defense of Ukraine. They signed Letters of Intent on cooperation. In addition, Memoranda have already been signed in certain coalitions, which allow centralized financing and procurement,- Rustem Umyerov said. According to the head of the Ministry of Defense, this applies to demining coalitions, drones, and IT. The Regulation on the Coalition of Maritime Capabilities was also signed. Such mechanisms enable countries to pool their resources for joint support of Ukraine's defense capabilities. Within the framework of the Air Defense Coalition, Ukrainian partners provided five new strategic air defense systems this year. Germany's Immediate Action of Air Defense initiative has already provided Ukraine with contributions worth over one billion euros. Also, in the Artillery Coalition, Ukraine received the first contributions to the production of Ukrainian artillery systems. As part of the Czech initiative, the supply of ammunition has already begun. -In addition, in the demining Coalition, we expect to purchase €22 million in the near future, and we have already received additional support from Sweden, and in the Drone Coalition, €50 million has been raised for the joint purchase of equipment, which will accelerate our fight on the front lines,- Rustem noted. Moderated Also, according to the Minister, an additional €1.4 billion was received for the defense of Ukraine from the revenues of the frozen assets of the Russian Federation. These funds will be directed in three main directions: ammunition, air defense equipment, and support for Ukrainian manufacturers. In particular, €400 million has been allocated for the production of weapons and military goods by Ukrainian companies. Rustem Umyerov noted that due to the sensitivity of the topic, many aspects of international activity remain non-public. -One notable result is the release of more than 3,300 people from Russian captivity since the start of the full-scale invasion. I am grateful to the Coordinating Staff for the Treatment of Prisoners of War and all the forces — the Office of the President, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the SBU, the Ombudsman — and the leaders of all countries who contributed to this achievement,- he said. As reported ArmyInform, our -defense- breaks records: every second ammunition on the front is Ukrainian.

Title: -Tentacles- of the guardsman -Octopus-: how they repelled meat assaults in the Pokrovsky direction
Description: The story of a guardsman published on the website of the National Guard of Ukraine. In order to repulse the meat assaults traditional for the occupiers, you had to have eight hands. -The assault began at 7 in the morning. We took the position we are in now. They dug in there, and they attacked us. They come in - I hear voices and take the machine gun - -Oh, guys, good day!-. They started working on them. We worked out, and then our guys worked with FPV drones,- recalls Sprut. As for FPV drones, Sprut saw for himself that the war is becoming more technological every month. This applies not only to robotics, but also to intelligence and communications. -The support is at a high level. Lish said that there was some noise somewhere - everything flew there. And artillery, and FPV drones, and mortars,- explains the guardsman. Earlier, ArmyInform told the story of the signalman -Phoenix-, who gives a second life to -radyejkams-.

Title: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine: the Russian aviation dropped three anti-aircraft m...
Description: This is reported in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 16 :00 September 23. Today, the Russian aviation dropped three anti-aircraft missiles on the territory of the Kursk region of the Russian Federation. Also, the occupiers hit Kurshchyna with anti-aircraft guns and barrel artillery. On the Kharkiv direction, Russian terrorists once stormed the positions of our units in the Liptsi district. Four times the enemy attacked our positions in the Kupyan direction. Ukrainian defenders repelled enemy assaults near Hlushkivka and Stelmakhivka. In the Lyman direction enemy units do not stop attacking in the areas of Cherneshchyna, Druzhelyubivka, Nevske, Makiivka, Dibrova, Torske settlements. Since the beginning of the day, Ukrainian soldiers have repelled six enemy attacks in this direction, and six more battles are still ongoing. Near Fedorivka in the Seversky direction, the defenders successfully repelled one enemy attack. With the support of attack aircraft in the direction of Kramatorsk, the invaders attacked the positions of the Defense Forces four times near Kalynyivka, Klishchiivka, Bila Hora and Predtechyny, near the last battle continues to this day. In the Toretsk direction, using attack and bomber aircraft, the enemy carried out 13 attacks. KABs struck the settlements of Shcherbynivka, Virolyubivka, and Kostyantynivka, and attacked near Dachny, Toretsk, and Nelipivka. The defenders of Ukraine are putting up a decent fightback, five attacks have been stopped, and seven more clashes are ongoing. In the Pokrovsky direction since the beginning of the day, the occupiers have already made 18 attempts to attack our defenders in the districts of Vozdvizhenka, Grodivka, Orlivka, and Marynivka. The defense forces restrained the enemy onslaught, all enemy attacks were repulsed. Twelve skirmishes took place in the Kurakhiv direction. The invaders tried to advance in the districts of Tsukuryny, Georgiyivka, Kostyantynivka and Katerynivka. Four fights are still in progress. In the Vremivsk direction, the invaders four times went on the offensive against the positions of the Ukrainian troops near Vugledar and Pavlivka, near which the battle is currently ongoing. In the Orikhov direction the occupiers attacked near Novoandriivka, the assault was successfully repelled, the situation is under control. On the Dnieper direction Defense forces opened two enemy attacks. At the moment, the enemy is not active in other directions. We will remind you that last The loss of the Russian invaders amounted to 1,330 people. Also, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed 16 tanks, 30 armored combat vehicles, 81 artillery systems, two MLRS, 71 operational-tactical UAVs, 79 vehicles, two heavy flame-throwing systems and a unit of special equipment.

Title: - Defense - breaks records: every second ammunition on the front is Ukrainian
Description: The Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov told about this. -We financed Ukrainian production for more than $4 billion. In Kharkiv Oblast, we repelled the Russian army with Ukrainian weapons. It was Ukrainian ammunition that provided the Armed Forces when we did not receive support from the United States,- the head of the defense department said. Today, every second piece of ammunition on the front is Ukrainian-made. If in 2023 the Ukrainian share of ammunition was 18%, then in 2024 it increased to 41%. -During this year, we have increased our long-range capabilities several times. In 2024, the Ministry of Defense alone contracted drones for over UAH 21 billion and ammunition for them for another UAH 9 billion. And together with the State Security Service, we purchased more than a million drones for our army. Thanks to the team of the Ministry of Statistics,- continued Rustem Umyerov. According to the head of the Ministry of Defense, Ukrainian drones showed what a real -Moscow never sleeps- is. Today, Ukrainian drones fly more than 1,000 km, reach Murmansk and Nadvolzhye, destroy Russian oil refineries and airfields. Ukraine was the first in the world to introduce the -swarm of drones- technology. In the last year alone, we managed to destroy or damage more than 200 targets on enemy territory. Among them are control points, airfields, ships, air defense systems and locations of Russian military personnel. Rustem Umyerov noted that this forced the enemy to relocate their planes to airfields 250 km from the border. -In the Black Sea, we forced Russian ships to flee from military bases in Crimea to the coast of the Krasnodar Territory. Without a full-fledged fleet, over the past year we have destroyed 10 Russian surface ships/boats and one submarine. Thanks to the DELTA combat system of the Ministry of Defense, we destroyed more than $15 billion worth of Russian equipment,- concluded the Minister of Defense. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministry of Defense plans to launch a new Veteran+ application.

If there are 24 KABs in Sumy Oblast, then they used 27 KABs in one district of Kursk Oblast, he said. For shelling, the occupiers mainly use long-range weapons, which can be used to strike from deep within their territory - guided aerial bombs and shock drones. Instead, the number of artillery and mortar fire decreased. At the same time, the Russians are also forced to strike first of all on their own territory. If the Russian military shelled Chernihiv, Sumy and part of the Kharkiv region 74 times in the past day, the enemy fired 91 times in just one district of the Kursk region. Title: Lovers of playing with fire near military vehicles can wear prison uniforms for 8 years
Description: This is reported by the Security Service of Ukraine. The Security Service and the National Police detained three more accomplices of the enemy who set fire to official cars of the Defense Forces in different regions of Ukraine. The priority -targets- of the participants were cars undergoing maintenance after completing combat missions on the front line. So, in Cherkasy: -on hot pursuit- they detained an 18-year-old local college student who, on the order of the Russian Federation, set fire to a military SUV with the help of a highly flammable mixture. It is noted that, expecting to receive a monetary -reward-, the young man recorded the fire on his phone camera and sent a video report to the Russian curator. However, he never received the promised -easy money- from the occupiers. Instead, the person involved received a suspicion from the investigators of the Security Service under part 1 of Art. 114-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (obstructing the lawful activities of the Armed Forces and other military formations during a special period),- the Security Service of Ukraine assured. The perpetrator is currently in custody. He faces up to 8 years in prison. In Ternopil: SBU and National Police officers detained two more arsonists who were part of a criminal group. Local residents turned out to be extras. Both men were looking for quick money in Telegram channels, where they were contacted by a representative of the Russian special services. In order to destabilize the socio-political situation in the western region, the enemy promised Paliam money in exchange for a series of arson attacks. However, they did not wait for the promised money, as the law enforcement officers arrested both criminals -on hot pursuit- after the first arson. Mobile phones were seized from them, which they used in subversive activities for the benefit of the Russian Federation. Both defendants were notified of suspicion under Part 2 of Article 28, Part 1 of Art. 114-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (obstructing the lawful activities of the Armed Forces and other military formations in a special period, committed by a group of persons following a prior conspiracy). Title: Housing for the military, construction audits, cost optimization — the defense infrastructure reform...
Description: About this informs September 23 Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. -According to the formed vision of the target structure of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine and the results of the functional audit, the infrastructural direction should undergo a transformation,- noted Stanislav Heyder. The Deputy Minister reminded that his team started taking care of this block a month and a half ago. -We consider infrastructure as one of the key components of our capabilities that must be developed. We have a clear understanding of what to do in the next six months and how to transform this sphere,- said Stanislav Heyder. According to him, work is already underway on the key points of the transformation processes in the defense infrastructure. Among them: In the conditions of war, in particular, constant missile strikes by the enemy, the development of the necessary military infrastructure for the placement of personnel and equipment is of critical importance. Based on the approaches of NATO member countries, a decision was made to form a military infrastructure development function on the basis of one of the divisions of the Ministry of Defense. This feature will be developed over the next two months. Our task is to define clear priorities and directions for wartime defense infrastructure funding before the start of the new budget year. By the end of the year, a number of organizational changes will be introduced that will remove duplication of functions in the direction of infrastructure. The administrative structures that currently deal with issues of construction organization in the Ministry of Defense will be significantly reduced without loss of potential. From January 1, 2025, purchases of secondary housing, modular structures, equipment and certain other items of the Ministry of Defense for a total amount of several billion hryvnias will be transferred to the State rear operator. The result of these actions will be the release of a significant financial resource. For the first time, the Ministry of Defense will conduct a comprehensive audit of military facilities under construction. Over the next 4-6 months, the IOU will carry out an inventory of all current and frozen projects in order to form a holistic vision of how to effectively spend funds in this direction in 2025 and subsequent years. A component of this vision will be a strategic plan for the management of objects under construction. The Ministry of Defense will change the approach to providing military housing. Instead of multi-year construction projects, clear and transparent financial mechanisms and financial support for housing will be introduced. The concept of such changes has already been formed, its discussion with financial institutions and non-governmental organizations has begun. In order to create a transparent electronic record of lands and buildings of the Ministry of Defense, work is underway on the appropriate IT system. A prototype of such a solution has already been created, and the first results of the implementation of electronic accounting are expected by the end of the year. Work has begun on the creation of a civil real estate agency that will manage land and other real estate on a commercial basis. Examples of NATO member countries are taken as the basis for the work of such an agency. In order to save costs for the operation of the infrastructure, the implementation of individual energy efficiency pilot projects has already begun. However, what is needed is a comprehensive policy and implementation of joint energy efficiency projects. Work is underway to launch a partnership project in this direction. During the war, the priority in cooperation with partners was and will be armaments. At the same time, the subject of discussion is also joint projects in the areas of construction, restoration (reconstruction) of defense infrastructure facilities, such as health care facilities, military educational institutions, etc. Bilateral security agreements concluded with partner countries can also become the basis of such joint projects. The implementation of joint projects will strengthen the capabilities of the Defense Forces both for military needs and for development needs.

Title: Ukraine and the state of Pennsylvania signed an agreement on the reconstruction of the Zaporizhzhia ...
Description: About informs the Office of the President of Ukraine. During the meeting, the prospects of cooperation between Ukraine and the United States of America at the regional level were discussed. -I thank the leaders of the American states for their willingness to develop regional cooperation with Ukraine. The implementation of joint economic projects will help restore the destroyed infrastructure and create jobs,- the Head of State noted. In the presence of Volodymyr Zelenskyi, the head of Zaporizhia OVA Ivan Fedorov and Josh Shapiro signed an agreement on cooperation between Zaporizhia OVA and the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Interaction between government bodies, scientific institutions, civil society organizations and business is envisaged. Among the main directions are energy, agriculture, digital technologies and defense. The agreement will also contribute to the reconstruction of the Zaporizhzhia region. More than 150,000 Ukrainians and Americans of Ukrainian origin live in the state of Pennsylvania. -Also, the production of weapons and military equipment is located here. For Ukraine, this direction is an absolute priority. We will be grateful for the strengthening of cooperation in this area,- the President emphasized. Five agreements have already been concluded between Ukrainian regions and American states. Previously, such documents were signed between Kyiv region and the state of Washington, between Kyiv region and the state of Utah, between Zhytomyr region and the state of Indiana, between Chernihiv region and the state of Minnesota. As ArmyInform reported, the President visited an ammunition plant in the USA, where shells are produced for Ukraine.

Title: The Ministry of Education and Culture said that military ecologists discovered demined areas of Myko...
Description: About this inform September 23 in the MOU. Soil samples were taken in places with the most damaged genetic soil layers. Military ecologists used the GNSS HiPer SR geodetic GPS receiver to accurately determine the coordinates. With the help of the X-ray fluorescence spectroscopy method and the ProSpektor-3 device, an express analysis for the presence of heavy metals was carried out. Military ecologists discovered the following elements: -A more detailed analysis of the selected soil samples will be carried out in the stationary conditions of the laboratory of the Center of Excellence for Mine Action and Environmental Safety according to the appropriate methods,- the message reads. The head of the Main Department of mine action, civil protection and environmental security, Colonel Ruslan Beregulya, noted that the investigations are being conducted in accordance with the decision of the National Mine Action Authority, approved by the Prime Minister of Ukraine. -Based on the results obtained, the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine will develop recommendations for the further use of demined lands in the country's agro-industrial complex. Title: They can fall anywhere: mines of a prohibited type are used by the enemy in the Kharkiv region
Description: Colonel Vitaliy Sarantsev, the spokesman of Kharkiv OTU, told about this on the air of the -Suspilne Novosti- telethon . - This is a dangerous type of weapon. -We have not yet fully investigated how large-scale their production process is - it can be either industrial or some local batch made with the help of Russian enthusiasts or volunteers,- he said. However, even if we are talking about artisanal production and a quantitatively insignificant batch of such mines, they do not become less dangerous. The power of their not too large explosive charge is enough to maim a person or even take his life if timely medical assistance is not provided. — This ammunition can be dangerous for both the military and civilians because the enemy scatters it in any area. He can drop it in those locations that, in his opinion, can be used by our military as routes for movement, the spokesman emphasized. He said that the occupiers install such mines remotely, dropping them on populated areas. - They can fall anywhere - in the yard, on the roof of the building, somewhere in the garden or in any place, - emphasized the military man. It is difficult to detect such ammunition due to its small size, camouflage color and a small number of metal parts. - It has a maximum of plastic parts, it is very difficult to detect it with a metal detector. If he, wrapped in green tape, falls into the grass, it is very difficult to see him, - explained the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv-. Title: Rebel lawyer: the scientist wanted to seize power in Odessa from Crimea
Description: The Security Service of Ukraine informed about this. According to the investigation, the suspects, under the guise of public organizations and commercial enterprises, created a paramilitary formation - the -Operational Combat Unit-, the purpose of which was to assist the aggressor state in the occupation of Odesa and the region. -The division was headed by a local lawyer - a -scientist-, a native of the Autonomous Republic of Crimea, who after the capture of the peninsula moved to Odessa, where he gathered followers who were personally loyal to him and ready to unconditionally follow orders and instructions. He chose his friend, a like-minded person, as co-leader,- the law enforcement officers said. According to the strategic plan of the -organization-, they were preparing to take over state institutions by force and overcome the resistance of the Defense Forces when Russian troops approached Odessa. In the event of the capture of the region, the participants of the formation were supposed to join the Russian occupation authorities and assume -positions-. More than 70 firearms, bulletproof vests, helmets, ballistic goggles and other tactical equipment, as well as demolition instructions, were seized during the searches. Currently, at the request of the prosecution, preventive measures in the form of detention have been chosen for the suspect. Investigative actions to identify all members of the -organization- are ongoing. Title: Fire on one's own is the norm for the enemy: what is the reason?
Description: The reason was explained on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- by the commander of the -Achilles- 92nd separate assault battalion. Captain Yury Fedorenko of the brigade named after Ivan Sirk, the basket captain. — The enemy, in the amount of firearms he uses and with the level of training of the personnel, quite often has practice on his own. In particular, due to the use of aviation. This is rather the norm for the enemy, he said. This is primarily about the low level of training of individual Russian servicemen who do not have sufficient knowledge, skills and abilities for combat work with appropriate weapons and military equipment. The situation in the Kupyan sector is more complicated, where the Russians are conducting active offensive actions with the use of a significant number of personnel, weapons and military equipment. — The adversary uses more than the overwhelming number of forces and means in order to reach the left bank of the Oskil River, then gain a foothold by occupying a bridgehead and develop further success, Yuriy Fedorenko reported. However, thanks to the joint coordinated work of the units of the Defense Forces operating on this stretch, the occupiers did not have any significant successes. Title: In the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra, military personnel undergo -Spiritual restoration through culture-
Description: Its first component — a 10-day rehabilitation for military personnel includes living on the territory of the Reserve, participation in archaeological excavations, master classes in icon painting and pottery, visiting museum exhibits, exploring the territories of the Upper and Lower Lavra and its caves accompanied by specialists of the Reserve, participating in services, communicate with spiritual mentors and monks of the monastery. The second component, called -Day in the Lavra for a military man-, involves immersion in the atmosphere and life of the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra for one day for groups of military personnel up to 20 people, accompanied by a tour guide. They explore the territory, listen to tours, join in the activities of the Reserve, visit local shrines and pray with spiritual guides. The general director of the National Reserve -Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra- Maksym Ostapenko told the correspondent of ArmiyaInform that -Spiritual restoration through culture- has a very positive effect on military personnel who undergo this program. — We combine here the cultural component, the spiritual component and, at the same time, the moral rehabilitation of those soldiers who come here. The Lavra itself is a place of prayer, a place of deep identity and culture that definitely inspires people. It is a powerful, outstanding place that has shaped our identity for a thousand years. And when people join these shrines, this incredible territory, they experience a very serious moral upliftment. After all, a person here feels his belonging to a large social organism called the people of Ukraine, the state of Ukraine, Maksym Ostapenko emphasized. Over a year, more than 900 military personnel and their family members have been through the program as part of the -Day at the Lavra for Military- component, as well as 26 chaplains and 102 military personnel in the ten-day recovery program. Currently, the program is planned, various units, all types and branches of the military, military chaplaincy services are involved. Fighters are encouraged, selected, and formed into groups. Lieutenant Colonel Volodymyr Samoilyk, chief specialist of the Department of Organization of Military Chaplains' Activities of the Military Chaplaincy Service of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, told about this. — The project is extremely important because the guys are in different conditions when they perform their combat duties. And this time, although it is small, is extremely important. It is important to stay in a holy place, a prayerful place, where soldiers can be not only alone, but also with a military chaplain who is in constant communication with them, explains, sometimes helps, sometimes instructs. And this is a good project, which we hope will work more powerfully in the future, Volodymyr Samoilyk said. — I expect, first of all, that the servicemen will rest spiritually and physically after coming here. And they will enjoy this rest, because now is a very active phase of hostilities. And people get very tired. Most of the people here are after injuries, serious injuries. Perhaps someone has not yet been to the Lavra. And I believe 100% that they will find such a corner for themselves here, which will be something good for them, will be remembered and will help them in the future to carry out military service in the defense of our Ukraine, - shared his vision of the group leader, chaplain service lieutenant , military chaplain of the 23rd Engineering and Position Regiment of the Support Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Taras Gordiychuk. For the first time, he organized the brothers to visit the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra. — Last week we had a group of servicemen of the National Guard of Ukraine who returned from captivity together with their families. This is a new category for us because we have mainly worked with military personnel either active duty or rehabilitating from hospitals. And we have not yet encountered the captives, but we are sure that this group of people is perhaps the most in need of support now in such facilities as the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra, because their psychological and moral condition requires deeper work. After all, these people went through very difficult tests, very heavy stress, and I am sure that a place like the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra can help many of them, - summed up Maksym Ostapenko. Today there is a constant demand for spiritual support and emotional support for military personnel, their families, families of the dead, prisoners of war, as well as military personnel undergoing rehabilitation and treatment in military hospitals. Next year, the renovation of building No. 55 of the National Reserve -Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra- is expected to be completed for the long-term stay of the military on the principle of pilgrim life. Rest rooms, rooms for master classes, and a library are planned to be installed in the center for the spiritual recovery of military personnel. Such practices, taking into account the possibility of scaling innovative models of spiritual restoration through culture and the support of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, will be gradually implemented on the bases of other historical and cultural reserves of Ukraine.

Title: The President visited an ammunition factory in the USA, where shells are produced for Ukraine
Description: informs about this Office of the President of Ukraine. Its capacities are fully loaded for the needs of Ukraine, in particular for the production of 155 mm caliber shells, which were significantly increased during the year. The head of state got acquainted with the production cycle and talked with the management and employees of the enterprise. During the meeting, the President talked about the situation on the battlefield and emphasized Ukraine's needs for uninterrupted and timely delivery of announced defense support packages. -It is an honor for us to start our visit to the United States of America precisely from Scranton, from this plant, from Pennsylvania. We are very happy to have such partners. Of course, we understand that the US has been helping us since the very beginning of the full-scale invasion. And we count on your continued support. Thank you to President Biden, the US Congress and all the workers of such plants,- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. Among the main topics of discussion is the importance of starting joint production of weapons on the territory of Ukraine, as well as the possibility of American investments in the Ukrainian defense industry. The President also noted that this and other American plants have already increased production several times and will continue to increase capacity. -400 people work here. I really wanted to come here and thank you. 400 people saved millions of Ukrainians. From myself and all our people, thank you very much. You helped us resist Putin's onslaught,- said the Head of State, addressing the factory workers. Volodymyr Zelenskiy also informed about a meeting with Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, Senator from this state Bob Casey and Congressman Matt Cartwright. -Grateful for all the support. We agreed to work even more actively so that our joint strength - Ukraine and America - increases,- the head of state added. He also expressed special gratitude to all those who welcomed to Scranton with the blue and yellow colors of our flag. As reported by ArmyInform, the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi together with the first lady arrived in the United States of America in order to strengthen the position of Ukraine and protect its citizens.

Title: 80,000 dead and the freezing of war: fakes are not only Russian
Description: So, on Friday, during a meeting with journalists, Volodymyr Zelenskyi had to deny the information of The Wall Street Journal, which wrote that the alleged losses of Ukraine in the war amounted to 80,000 soldiers. -80 thousand? This is a lie. The real figure is much lower than what was published. Significantly,- said the President of Ukraine. Let me remind you that on September 17, the American newspaper The Wall Street Journal wrote that the number of killed and wounded Ukrainians and Russians participating in the war allegedly reached 1 million people. In particular, as the journalists claimed, 80,000 Ukrainian servicemen and 200,000 Russians were allegedly killed during the military operations. It is worth noting that the New York edition has recently come under severe criticism, in particular, due to the -global purge of editorial departments and the creation of a politically correct workforce.- Unfortunately, this is not the first time that the Western mass media have played along with the Russians, publishing in their materials information about Ukraine that does not correspond to reality. Just recently, the German tabloid newspaper Bild wrote about Ukraine's alleged readiness to -freeze- the war, referring to the Victory plan of the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi. Journalists assured that the plan allegedly prescribes Ukraine's -readiness- to accept a -local ceasefire on certain areas of the front-. Zelensky was forced to react, assuring that Bild had spread a fake. No one will give the Russians Minsk-3 or any other format of freezing the war. Ukraine is categorically against this and the authorities at all levels are talking about it. It is important for us that the United States of America, which is able to ensure its implementation, supports the Victory Plan of Ukraine, and not capitulations or freezes. That is why it is always worth trusting official, and not anonymous sources, which are often used by the creators of information -dumps-.
