Title: There are problems in Russia: why did Putin increase the size of the army
Description: — First of all, let's analyze what was in the Russian Federation in terms of the number of all personnel before the large-scale invasion. The entire personnel, together with civilian personnel, was estimated at around one million 100 thousand. No more, plus or minus. In two and a half years, the Russian Federation lost more than 630,000 personnel. These are fantastic figures since the end of World War II. There was nothing like that. Let me remind you that the Soviet Union lost 15,500 during the entire war in Afghanistan, over 10 years. Russia is experiencing a serious problem of lack of manpower in the war. She has to compensate for the significant losses. Therefore, the Russians have no particular choice. Plus there is a so-called anticipatory extermination. What is it? The average rate of destruction of the enemy for us per month, especially during this summer, is 34-36 thousand. As of this minute, according to the full-time mobilization that the occupiers are carrying out, they are putting 32-34 thousand people in line. This backlash of 2,000 raschits seems to be small, but in fact it is very decisive. Therefore, they have no other choice but to increase the number of troops. — Is it a lot, plus 180,000 personnel. To some extent yes. The initial contingent of the Russian Federation that invaded Ukraine was about 180-200 thousand. But if you proceed from the opposite and understand that now the entire line of combat confrontation has approximately 600 thousand Russian invaders, then in order to really break something (our line of defense - ed), you need to double or triple this figure. The expert believes that with that type of mobilization in the Russian Federation, this is impossible. Do they have a mobilization resource from which to draw -cannon fodder-? Yes it is. It is up to three million men. But in order to actually change something on the battle line, the Russians need to go beyond the figures of 40-50 thousand per month. Will they go for it? I think not. Why? Because it will be a real social tension. And Putin is afraid of rebellion from below like fire. True, an uprising from below is impossible in itself, but it can be provoked by just one of the -Kremlin towers-. Everything the enemy does is logical. But I would not say that there is something mega unexpected from their side. And I am of the position that increasing the number of the army by 180 thousand to change the course in this phase of the war will not be decisive. No one in Russia has ever thought about training, emphasizes Petro Chernyk. For the Kremlin, Russian conscripts have always been just -cannon fodder.- — We understand that the enemy acts according to a very simple logic. You can learn to use a Kalashnikov assault rifle in 5 days. And they never cared about more serious tactical training there and never will. Therefore, it is not necessary to ask the question that, allegedly, the staff is poorly trained and this should somehow make our life easier. But remember that they just take a huge amount. I had personal experience in one of the tactical areas of the battlefield already this year. In 12 hours of assessing losses on our side and their side, we lost one killed, and they lost 24. This is so that we understand how much the Rashists do not respect personnel. If we take the two main categories of providing units and units of the Russian Armed Forces - artillery and armored vehicles - then the enemy does not have a single unit that is 80% manned, emphasizes Petro Chernyk. — If the enemy has security within 60%, it is already very good for him. But I emphasize once again, the Russians now mainly, in addition to massive artillery strikes, which have also significantly decreased in contrast to the summer of 2022, are betting on large infantry ramparts. Let me remind you that more than 100 million Kalashnikov assault rifles were produced. Of course, there are no 100 million in Russian warehouses, but there are millions. 37 million Mosin rifles were produced, 9 million RPG-7, the most massive hand-held anti-tank grenade launcher, 1.5 million RPG-18 Mukha, a reactive anti-tank grenade, 15 million Simonov self-loading carbines, and there are still up to 8 in Russian warehouses millions of Shpagin submachine guns and Sudayev submachine guns since World War II. And if the enemy needs them, they will be taken from there. It must be correctly emphasized, this number of 180 thousand Russians is purely for the provision (replenishment of losses - ed.) of these large infantry ramparts. That is, theoretically, this contingent of the enemy is for 5 months of ensuring the war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine.

Title: Mobilized in NATO camouflage: fern on helmet and combat makeup on Interflex
Description: The correspondent of ArmiyaInform told about what methods of camouflage according to NATO standards are taught to Ukrainian mobilized during basic combined military training within the borders of the Interflex multinational training mission on the territory of Great Britain. The forest is moist and guarded. The wet krill, which wandered into the forest almost close to my shelter, still felt the danger and ran away. It is not easy to deceive a forest animal - on its side, hearing, sight, smell and knowledge of the area are sharp. However, now our task is not hunting - we have to hide in the forest from the enemy. At the next PPE class at Interflex, we learn basic knowledge, acquire skills and practice the skills of choosing, arranging and masking a shelter. The behavior of animals and birds is one of the signs that can betray us to the enemy. The screeching hum of a frightened flock of birds or, on the contrary, a bristling unnatural silence in the forest can indicate the presence of a person. However, there are almost no birds in our forest. Like, by the way, insects too - every once in a while you will encounter a beetle or be lucky enough to come across an anthill. Mosquitoes and flies, so annoying in Ukraine, are practically absent - probably due to the special island climate or the time of year. The escape of the rabbit looks quite natural - the timid animal could react to anything. So we can hope that the enemy lurking on the other side has not detected our presence due to the behavior of the animal. It is really not easy to notice us from the side of the field, because in addition to the usual camouflage form - most of us have a Ukrainian pixel, but there are also -British- - we have taken additional measures for camouflage. Some of these techniques are exclusive to the instructors, so it's not worth reporting them - let it be a surprise for the enemy. Others are quite obvious and widely used, so you can talk about them openly. There are several masking classes, they take place at different times and in different ways. The teaching method allows you to combine knowledge, abilities and skills from previous theoretical explanations and practical exercises and independently construct something new. This is the advantage of the teaching methods of foreign instructors. What we are taught is not an absolute unbreakable dogma, but rather the details of a constructor, each of which we must personally incorporate into our actions during the task. It is impossible to predict absolutely everything that will await you on the battlefield. But it is quite possible to work out certain modules and action algorithms, the combination of which in different combinations will allow you to adapt and use any conditions as efficiently as possible. Choosing from the acquired knowledge what fits the most right here and now, we put the elements of the acquired knowledge into the general puzzle of actions within the limits of specific conditions, creating a unique mosaic of combat. Among the basic elements of preparation for combat operations in the forest is the application of camouflage paint on the face. We start the preparation for the imitation of a combat exit with the morning make-up, painting the face with green, black and brown paints. For this, we have a special cosmetic bag with rich dyes, where dense green predominates. It is the main background on which we apply brown and black colors, creating the impression of a play of light and shadow among trees, bushes and weeds. It is not possible to paint the face too richly, because we will have the opposite of the desired effect - a bright grass-colored face with charcoal streaks and spots will sparkle in contrast among the vegetation and will be visible from afar even in the forest. Therefore, we apply paint in barely noticeable layers. -Commando in the jungles of Indochina,- someone quips. After wearing camouflage, we really look like American special forces somewhere in the area of ​​approaches to the Ke-San base. For those familiar with the history of the US war in Vietnam, there are indeed many parallels, from combat makeup to jungle warfare tactics. It is noticeable that the military of NATO countries deeply study the experience of all previous military conflicts, developing appropriate tactical techniques on its basis. The next step is to modify the spherical shape of the helmet using the tools at hand. In the forest, it immediately attracts attention, because in the natural environment, something close in shape to a perfect sphere is almost never found. So we attach to the helmet small twigs and ferns, with which the edges of the forest are covered. Now, if we carefully crawl from the depths of the forest into the fern thickets, we will be practically invisible to those looking at the forest from the side of the open field. We check the weapons and equipment once more, paying special attention to the combat make-up and the helmet-mounted spears - they must be strong enough. When the preparation is completed, we go to the edge of the forest to choose observation positions. About eight in the morning. It's been a little over three hours since the start of another training day, so we still have about 15 hours to master this element of the martial art. The intensity of the BZVP within the confines of the Interflex training mission in Great Britain is poisonous. From former civilians, we are increasingly turning into real soldiers.

Title: Fighter against underwater threats: NATO ordered unmanned robots to neutralize mines
Description: As stated in the official release of ECA Group, which is the founding company of Exail, the amount of the concluded contract reaches €60 million. And the main consumers of the future automated minesweepers will be the Navy units of Belgium and the Kingdom of the Netherlands, ArmyInform reports. The agreement, in particular, provides for the direct supply of K-Ster C underwater mine disposal equipment, K-Ster CT training vehicles and related equipment to the Alliance military. The K-Ster blocks will be assembled on Exail's production lines at its Belgian plant in Ostend. The factory, due to open in 2022, is already producing a number of drones for the Belgian and Kingdom of the Netherlands navies as part of a program to modernize their mine countermeasures capabilities. -We are very pleased to continue our support to the Navy of Belgium and the Kingdom of the Netherlands and NATO allies with our advanced demining technology. This new contract is a testament to our commitment to providing innovative and reliable solutions for MCM operations. In Ostend, we have all the necessary manufacturing infrastructure to produce these new systems,- said Anthony Penn, Commercial Director of Exail. The K-Ster C is a single-use unmanned underwater explosive countermeasures vehicle designed for effective mine clearance. Outwardly, it is somewhat similar to a classic torpedo. The device has a compact design that ensures easy deployment and operation, and is also equipped with a powerful cumulative charge that can effectively neutralize all types of mines. Its high maneuverability and advanced guidance system allow it to accurately target and detonate enemy infernal devices, ensuring safe and reliable minefield clearance. For its part, the K-Ster CT is a special version of the drone, created for training purposes and equipped with an inert warhead. This allows for realistic and effective training of Navy personnel without the risks associated with live ammunition. Remotely controlled underwater vehicle K-STER has a mass of 50 kg, a length of 1.5 m, a hull diameter of 230 mm, a speed of 6 knots, the duration of the task up to one hour. A special feature of the K-STER device design is a bow compartment with a combat charging compartment that can be rotated in the vertical plane. The turning angles of the nose compartment are from −90° to +90°, the mass of the explosive is 6 kg. This ensures the optimal angle of impact on the mine with a cumulative jet. The power plant of the K-STER device includes a lithium-ion battery and four reversible thrusters. The K-STER device is equipped with an omnidirectional hydroacoustic station with a range of operating frequencies of 500–1200 kHz and a range of 40–100 m. In addition, the device is equipped with a color video camera and a light. The K-STER device is controlled via a fiber-optic cable. As note the authors of the Naval News portal, in addition to units of the Belgian Navy and the Dutch Navy, these anti-mine devices have also been chosen and used by the defense forces of about 20 countries. K-STER C underwater drone for neutralizing sea mines. Video: Exail

Title: Four km under drones for 5 hours: the soldier - Fighter - told how he and his comrades evacuated the...
Description: In the Armed Forces - from July 2023. This year, in the Zaporozhye direction, he participated in several successful trips as part of the evacuation group. How is it 4 kilometers to carry the body of a brother and hide from enemy drones every minute? What is the most important thing for a driver transporting a seriously injured person? But what injuries are currently the most common on the front? -Boyets- told our correspondent about this. I remember my first visit. We had to evacuate the body of our fallen brother. It was in the Verbovoy district, in the Zaporozhye direction. Then at 5 o'clock in the morning we left. At first they were on the BMP, because they still had to bring water to the boys at the position. We are just approaching, and they immediately start firing at us with a mortar. The enemy noticed us. I immediately hid. They waited a little and followed the body of their brother. They carried him back for about five hours. The distance covered was more than four kilometers. While they were carrying them, they periodically listened for drones and hid from them. There were four of us, but it is difficult to carry when the deceased weighs more than 100 kg. As soon as they heard the drone, they ran in different directions, immediately covered themselves with a branch or something else, or hid in a chance. We walked like this for two kilometers and met a guy from the 82nd brigade. He was the -three hundredth-. Our brother helped him, applied a tourniquet. Then we took his machine to make it easier for him to go, and he went ahead of us. He had a wound in his hand and some shrapnel. So he went out with us then. Finally, we reached a point where there were no enemy drones. The next exit was at my place, when a wounded person was taken away. The boys followed him, and I had to pick them up in the car. At that time we had a T4 bus. When you are a driver, in such cases it is important to think that you have to return from this exit alive. When I was leaving, I prayed as I should, I told myself that I must be alive and well, and that I must get my brothers out. Our guys, who were carrying this wounded man to the car, wanted to take a smoke break because they were tired. But they still decided to deliver it as soon as possible. Then it was necessary to drive very quickly, because the wounded person was bleeding profusely. If I had arrived 15 minutes later, this guy would not be alive. We immediately took him to the hospital. And they said that we were on time. The hospital was located nearby. And I constantly gave gas while driving. And dear, you understand what it is like there. The third exit, I remember, the injured person was not very difficult. But it had to be taken away very quickly. At that position, the enemy burned the dugout. In addition to the wounded, I took his brothers, because they were also affected a little. They immediately took him to the hospital again. Two drivers always go on such trips, because anything can happen. But this time I had to go myself. When I arrived at the point, the boys were already waiting for me in the bushes. We were going back, then there was a flight in our direction, about 50 meters nearby. It didn't affect me, I turned around and gave even more gas to get there faster. Then took them out. Now, as far as I know, everyone is alive and well. …As a rule, the front lines of all injuries are hands, feet, and eyes. Because enemy mortars and drones work there most often. I want to say this to the new recruits who are currently joining the army: if the instructors teach you something, then try, don't be lazy. Freebies are not an option here. Obey the commanders. And most importantly, study. Because it will make sense only if you prepare well. This will save your life on the battlefield.

Title: The head of state on the Victory Plan: The decisive time for the course of the war is coming this fa...

He emphasized that the further course of the war will be decided this fall, and Ukraine, together with its partners, can strengthen its position to achieve victory and a just peace. -Ukraine will present the Victory Plan in the United States, and the President of the United States and world leaders will be the first to see it in full. We will also present him in Congress - to both parties and candidates for the presidency of the United States,- the head of state said. The President emphasized that the United States has all the necessary power to help Ukraine achieve peace together with its allies. He noted that the visit includes important meetings with the leaders of the G7 countries, Europe and the Global South, as well as with representatives of international organizations. Volodymyr Zelensky thanked the USA and all countries that support Ukraine in the fight against Russian aggression. According to him, the protection of Ukraine is not only a Ukrainian matter, but also an issue for the future of the democratic world. -True peace and a real victory for Ukraine and international law is what we need,- the President summarized.

Title: You can fight for an entrance for a week: the city battles in Vovchansk were described in the Defens...
Description: An officer of the -Rubizh- brigade of the National Guard told about the city battles in Vovchansk on the telethon -Yedini Novyny- Volodymyr Chernyak of Ukraine. - Now we are slowly forcing the Russians to attack less and defend more. However, this does not mean that there are any counteroffensive actions. Large-scale counteroffensive actions are still a long way off, as the Russians still have an advantage in manpower and weapons, he said. Vovchansk is almost completely destroyed, which complicates the actions of both the soldiers of the Defense Force and the invaders. — Vovchansk is almost completely destroyed, this does not benefit either side, as shelters are becoming fewer and fewer. Street battles are mostly hiding and maneuvers that take place almost constantly from building to building, even for each entrance you can fight for a week, - explained the soldier. However, he noted, the situation is slowly but steadily leaning in favor of the Ukrainian defenders, although it is too early to talk about any significant successes. Title: 500 meters to Romania: - travelers - were detained for attempting to cross the border illegally
Description: About informsState Border Service of Ukraine. All the detainees turned out to be residents of Transcarpathia. -To achieve their goal, the -travellers- chose a flat section of the state border, but this choice did not ensure their success, because the border guards effectively protect the Ukrainian border,- the message reads. 500 meters from the state border, the Transcarpathians were detained by the outfit, after which, in order to find out all the details of the offense, they took them to the border unit. In relation to the detainees, protocols were drawn up on the administrative offense provided for in Art. 204-1 of the Criminal Procedure Code -Illegal crossing or attempted illegal crossing of the state border of Ukraine-, the case was referred to the court. Title: On rusty -motorcycles-: in the Kharkiv direction, the occupiers use outdated Soviet armored vehicles
Description: This was explained by a military officer from with the callsign -Stig- is an officer of the 2nd separate detachment of the Special Purpose Center -OMEGA- of the National Guard of Ukraine. -The occupiers are using armored vehicles for logistics, to replenish personnel at the forward positions,- he said. According to the military, the enemy cannot use it during assaults. — This is more about replenishing some logistics and advanced positions with personnel. Because almost the entire territory of the battle line is controlled by UAV strike groups. And if it is not impossible to drive in an armored vehicle just like that, then it is very close to it, he explained. The officer noted that these are primarily outdated samples of Soviet equipment, which the Russians do not regret. — They use this technique in one way. That is, it is not some kind of advanced technology. These are old Soviet models, such as MTLB, BMP-1, BMD and so on. They simply send one, two, sometimes three units of armored vehicles to the position and understand that this vehicle may not even reach the position, he explained. Similarly, Russian commanders do not spare their own soldiers. -And if it reaches the position, it does not have time to unload and is destroyed literally before the occupier can even disembark with this equipment,- said the military officer. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kharkiv Oblast the Russians throw recently mobilized prisoners on -meat assaults-.

Title: The DSHV showed the work of one of the most important areas of modern warfare
Description: This is reported by command of the Airborne Assault Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -Reb is one of the most important areas in modern warfare. After all, it is UAVs that pose one of the biggest threats to our fighters,- the message says. In particular, reconnaissance drones target artillery, missiles, and anti-aircraft missiles. FPV strike drones are weapons that deal significant damage to Ukrainian infantry. -EW tools are our shield. Thanks to the work of the workshop of the 77th brigade, it is possible to make effective devices that protect the infantry. And what is very important is to make them cheaper and faster than on the market,- noted the command of the DSHV. According to one military officer, with the help of UAV-reconnaissance, with which radio-electronic warfare is fought, the enemies target both -shahedis- and all their missiles. Therefore, it is very important to know how to protect yourself from FPV drones. -Each EW means is a power supply, interference generation and radiation (antenna) systems. And also plastic cases to protect them. Chinese antennas are usually of very low quality, so we make them ourselves. It takes about 8 hours to make one antenna housing. A set of three antennas is a day,- the defender said. He noted that the cost of one antenna (cables, connectors, plastic) is about 1,000 hryvnias, and to buy a similar one requires from 3 to 4 thousand hryvnias. -In terms of characteristics, our antenna is even better because we know what we are making it from and check it at every stage. We invest about 50,000 hryvnias in one EW device, manufacturers sell from 120,000 hryvnias per analogue,- the military officer explained. Earlier, ArmyInform showed how fighters of the Rubaka attack UAV unit of the 77th Dnipro Airborne Brigade /->tracked down and destroyed Russian long-range howitzer 2C19 -msta-.

Title: Away with barbecues and barns? The occupiers are changing the ways of protecting armored vehicles
Description: About this on the broadcast of the telethon -Edyny Novyny- told the crew commander of the UAV -Kara Nebesna- UAV of the -Rubizh- brigade - officer Andriy Otchenash. - They had a period of time when they completely sheathed their equipment that could not move the turret and used it as a -taxi-. Currently, they are trying to somehow modernize their methods of defense against FPV copters so that the tank can be used directly as a tank, and at the same time, to be able to transport personnel with quality, he said. Therefore, the Russians are trying to preserve the maneuverability and firepower of their armored vehicles. — Heavy equipment and transports enemy personnel and sometimes even manages to withdraw without casualties. There were moments when they drove up close to our positions, shot at our positions and had the opportunity to drive away, the officer said. In his opinion, this indicates that the occupiers are using powerful EW tools. - This is a sign that they are using high-quality electronic warfare systems because our FPV drones simply cannot fly up, said the drone commander. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the Russians trenches are dug by suicide soldiers.

Title: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine: The aggressor increased the number of attacks to five ...

The enemy also carried out ten airstrikes on the territory of the Kursk region, using 12 anti-aircraft missiles. In the Kharkiv direction two enemy attacks took place in the Vovchansk region. The battle continues. The situation is under control. On the Kupyansk direction during the day, the enemy tried to advance to our positions in the areas of Petropavlivka, Synkivka, Hlushkivka, Kruglyakivka, Lozova and Stelmakhivka. Five enemy attacks are still in progress. In total, ten clashes were recorded in this direction. The occupiers dropped a total of nine aerial bombs in the districts of Kupyansk, Kupyansk-Vuzlovoy and Pershotravnevoy. In the Lyman direction the aggressor increased the number of attacks to five. Fighting took place near Cherneshchyna, Druzhelyubivka, Novosadovo, and Dibrova. Two skirmishes are ongoing. In the Northern direction the enemy tried to break through our defenses in the Vyimka area. The situation is under control. The occupier also carried out airstrikes with guided aerial bombs on the areas of the settlements of Ivanovtsi, Svyat Pokrovske and Sloviansk. In the Kramatorsk direction, our defenders continue to repulse two attacks by the occupiers near Kalynyivka and Klishchiivka. Near Hryhorivka and Stupochki, five enemy attacks have already been stopped. The enemy used unguided air missiles on Stupochki. In the Toretsk direction the invader, with the support of attack and bomber aircraft, attacked four times in the districts of Dachne, Toretsk, Shcherbynivka and Nelipivka. There is a battle near Toretsk. In the Pokrovsky direction, the greatest activity of the enemy remains. Clashes of varying intensity started 21 times. Fighting is currently ongoing in six locations in the districts of Novotoretsk, Grodivka, Novogrodivka, and Marynivka. During the day, the aircraft of the occupiers flew in the direction of Oleksandropol. A difficult situation remains in the Kurakhiv direction. The Defense Forces repelled six assaults near Hirnyk, Tsukuryny, Zhelanny Drugo and Katerynivka, and four skirmishes are also ongoing near Kostyantynivka and Hirnyk. In the Vremivsk direction, the aggressor is attacking near Ugledar and Vodyanyi, currently there are four skirmishes. Enemy aircraft also struck near Bogoyavlenka, Urozhany and Rivnopol. No active actions of the occupiers have been recorded today in the Gulyajpil and Orihiv directions. The enemy carries out airstrikes and artillery fire on the positions of our troops and populated areas. In the Dnieper direction our defenders repelled one enemy assault. As reported by ArmyInform, the loss of the Russian invaders last day armiyi-rf-za-dobu/-> totaled 1,500 people. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 22 tanks, 52 armored fighting vehicles, 63 artillery systems, two anti-aircraft guns, 67 UAVs of the operational-tactical level, 57 vehicles and 19 units of special techniques

Title: In the Kharkiv region, the Russians are throwing recently mobilized prisoners to -meat assaults
Description: A representative of the communications service told about this on the air of Suspilne.Novyny. public relations officer of the 13th brigade of NSU -Chartiya- Volodymyr Degtyarev. -We know from the interceptions and from communication with the prisoners that recently mobilized from places of restriction of freedom are being used against us, who are being mobilized into former Wagner and now Defense Ministry units,- the speaker said. From the stories of the prisoners, it is known that they are literally taught something for several weeks at the training grounds, and then they are sent on foot to attack in one direction. -The situation in our brigade's area of ​​responsibility is tense, but thanks to the fact that we have learned to see far into the enemy's positions, sometimes to act in advance, during one of the assaults we were able to advance the enemy and liberate another part of Kharkiv region,- said the spokesman. He added that the enemy has not carried out massive attacks for several weeks. Three weeks ago, -Charter- soldiers repelled an attack by a tank company, in which 11 tanks were involved.

Title: -Biloocupant- and Russian equipment did not go far - they were met by the soldiers of the Third Assa...
Description: They released a video of combat work on their channel. -A tank, six trucks and a cyclist - hit on the front line! One of the overturned cars was transporting Russian infantry. Other occupiers were found in the field, green area and in the dugout. In order to disrupt the enemy's communications, they also shot down the enemy's antenna,- the defenders said. Title: Enemy Motorized Infantry: Advantages and Disadvantages explained in Defense Forces
Description: The advantages and disadvantages of the use of motorcycles by the Russian occupiers, as well as why the enemy resorts to their use, on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyni- explained a military man with the call sign -Stig- - an officer of the 2nd separate detachment of the Special Purpose Center -OMEGA- of the National Guard of Ukraine. - First, a motorcycle is a light, maneuverable, high-speed, highly mobile target. When there are many of them, it is very difficult for even strike UAVs to engage several targets at once. Therefore, some of them reach their destination, he said. At the same time, the use of motorcycle equipment also has a number of disadvantages. -The disadvantage of this tactic is that this target is not armored,- he explained. Due to the lack of any protection, even during an inaccurate hit of ammunition next to an enemy motorcyclist, debris can either injure or even eliminate the occupant, and completely disable his vehicle. — We have already worked on these goals and are well acquainted with such tactics. They have been using it since at least this spring, the military said. He explained why the Russians resort to the use of motorcycles. - First of all, armored vehicles often simply do not reach places that can be reached by motorcycle. They have to carry out their replenishment, logistics, and they do it on motorcycles, because sometimes there is simply no other way for them, said the officer. Another drawback is the low carrying capacity of motorcycle equipment, but the occupiers even try to evacuate the wounded on motorcycles. -We saw a group of four motorcycles evacuating moderately injured people,- Stig said. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the north of Kharkiv Oblast, the -rats on mopeds- did not get there - the biker occupiers blew up the mines.

Title: The occupiers hit Sloviansk: three injured, houses destroyed
Description: This was reported by the Kramatorsk City Council. -Several houses were destroyed in Cherevkivka. A lot was damaged,- said the head of the Slovian city military administration, Vadym Lyakh. Local authorities report at least three injuries and the destruction of several private buildings. Earlier, Russian troops strike on neighboring Kramatorsk, due to apartment buildings were damaged by shelling. As reported by ArmyInform, on September 21, the city of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk region was under fire from Russian troops throughout the day, there are dead and wounded.

Title: Productive, not when you killed seven people there, but when you made sure that yours were not kille...
Description: The corresponding video was released on September 22 by the Khortytsia operational-strategic group of troops. -Sniper is a profession that requires calm, balance. I can't count how many of them I've killed. I'm counting how many I've lost here. That's more important to me. It's productive for me, not when you kill 5, 6, 7 there, but when you make sure that yours are not killed. This is the most important thing,- assures the female sniper. According to her, there are no people there for her. -Only creatures that have human form. So first, tenth, twentieth, it doesn't matter. The main thing is for him to leave our land,- she says. Another sniper notes that he always thinks about destroyed villages and cities before going out. He says that he will never forgive this. -The enemy will learn about the fact that the group was working in a certain area along the line of combat contact, counting their losses,- the Khortytsia OSU emphasizes. Tomorrow morning, Ukrainian snipers will go out again. As reported by ArmyInform, a sniper of the 77th separate airmobile brigade of the Russian Air Force with the call sign -Wolf- told how to prepare and what is important during combat work.

Title: Taurian paratroopers repelled a massive assault: the invaders used 44 units of armored vehicles
Description: This was reported by the press service of the brigade. The brigade's aerial scouts detected the advance of enemy columns in time, and our artillery began to work immediately. During the battle, our soldiers destroyed five armored vehicles with landing forces. Panic began in the battle formations of the enemy, the equipment began to retreat. 28 occupiers were killed in this attack, another 22 were wounded. Title: -Disposable slaves- in -zombieland-: suicide soldiers are digging trenches for the Russians
Description: The crew commander of the -Kara Nebesna- UAV crew of the -Rubizh- brigade told about this on the air of the Yedyny Novyni telethon - officer Andriy Otchenash. — The Russian Federation has one of the most powerful engineering forces in the world, unfortunately. Due to the fact that they have conditionally slave soldiers, no matter how ridiculous it sounds. They have whole units of -disposables- that are launched to dig trenches, to dig positions. Unfortunately, they do it very quickly and very qualitatively, he said. The officer reported that the defenders of Ukraine had repeatedly observed cases when such -disposable slaves- of the enemy entered the positions without weapons. - There have been several situations where they start groups even without weapons. Maybe in armor, helmets, but without weapons - with shovels, picks, all means to dig out positions. And they just dig 24/7, said the soldier. Enemy soldiers, realizing that they can save themselves only by digging in as deep as possible, dig trenches with maximum intensity. In some cases, enemy positions are equipped even by persons who are not dressed in military uniform. - They are dressed in ordinary black robes, not like military personnel. They don't have weapons, but they dig, and after a day or two or three you see that there are actually lines of trenches that appeared out of nowhere, Andriy Otchenash said. Such a tactic gives the enemy, who does not count on any losses, the desired result. - You seem to throw ammunition at them, you seem to destroy the personnel. And they just send new -meat-, which continues to dig. It looks like a zombie land, but unfortunately it's an effective zombie land, he said. Sometimes the enemy soldiers assigned to equip the positions do not have any individual protection. - We have repeatedly seen that military personnel enter sometimes even without armor, without helmets and absolutely without any weapons. They really only go there to dig, - said the officer. The military assumed that in this way in the Russian army they can be punished for some crimes. - Sometimes they are punished like this, it is a punishment: if you survive - well done, if you do not survive - not well done. But the very fact that this is such a widespread phenomenon is extremely surprising. Unfortunately, it is surprising with its effectiveness, said the drone commander. At best, 50% of such -disposable- suicide bombers survive, but the other half still digs out chances and arranges sufficiently high-quality dugouts, which are then entered by soldiers of the Russian army prepared for combat operations. Earlier, ArmyInform reported on attacks -on foot- by the dead- — the -murderous tactics- of the Russians in the Kharkiv direction.

Title: When they approach, the invaders jump out of the transport: our fighters destroy the enemy

Title: Six Russian fighter jets were found over the Baltic Sea in two days
Description: This was reported by the Air Force of Latvia. According to their reports, violations were recorded on September 20 and 21. Russian planes did not turn on their transponders and did not provide a flight plan. Eurofighter fighters of the German Air Force, involved in the NATO mission to protect the airspace of the Baltic countries, were taken into the air. The fighters warned the Russian pilots and escorted them to the border. As the online edition reminds Delfi, the Ministry of Defense of Latvia has increased surveillance of the airspace after the incident on September 7, when a Shahed drone fell in the Haigalivska Volost of the Rezekne Region. Russia actively uses these Iranian-made drones in the war against Ukraine. The activation of Russian aircraft increased after the Russian Navy exercises -Ocean-2024-, during which Russian and Chinese warships conducted joint exercises from September 10 to 16, which are part of Russia's largest naval exercises since the time of the Soviet Union. However, as the head of the intelligence center of the Estonian Defense Forces, Colonel Ants Kiviselg, noted at the press conference, the exercises were less extensive than expected. -Part of the training took place in the Baltic Sea. Russia stated that 90,000 personnel and 400 ships would take part in them, however, according to our assessment, the exercises were on a much smaller scale and took place at a low level. First of all, flights of strategic bombers and some reconnaissance flights were carried out,- – he said. The General Staff of the Estonian Defense Forces reported that the Baltic Fleet's share of activity was insignificant. The exercise culminated in local actions by the various fleets and was more of a demonstration than a real training process.

Title: The Navy of the Ukrainian Armed Forces explained why the Russians massively withdrew missile carrier...
Description: -From the base point, they ->released just last week, most likely it was a fear of a possible attack on. After that, they immediately returned and remain there,- Dmytro Pletenchuk said. The spokesman explained that for Russians in the Azov-Black Sea region, most of the Black Sea remains closed, and the Azov Sea is completely closed. -Therefore, they remain at the base point, in the harbor itself, the ships are forced to move periodically in order to avoid possible damage from our side,- he added. Dmytro Pletenchuk noted that the Russians do not take out ships often, only a submarine is always on the external raid. But mostly the boat performs the functions of guarding the base point, stays at sea for weeks without using weapons. -Therefore, it cannot be said that this missile carrier is used as a carrier. There is a tendency that they are present in the sea only by submarine. As for the rest of the carriers, they are permanently at the base station,- he said. In general, the Russian Black Sea fleet has three submarines, three missile ships of the Buyan-M project, one of which is under repair, and two frigates. -That is, five carriers of eight missiles and three carriers of four missiles,- Dmytro Pletenchuk explained. As ArmiyaInform reported, as of the morning of September 22, there is one enemy ship in the Black Sea, which is a carrier of -Caliber- cruise missiles with a total salvo of up to 4 missiles.

The Russians also, with the support of aviation, stormed the positions of Ukrainian units near Toretsk, Shcherbynivka, and Nelipivka. Seven attacks of the aggressor have been repelled, four have not yet been completed. In the Pokrovsky direction since the beginning of the previous day, the enemy attacked 25 times in the areas of Novotoretsk, Selidovy, Novogrodivka, Krasny Yar, Vozdvizhenka, Mykhailivka, and Marynivka. Our defenders repelled 24 assaults. The battle is still going on near Selidovoy. Yesterday, according to preliminary data, 460 occupiers were neutralized in this direction, 188 of them - irreversibly. Two armored combat vehicles and 11 cars were also destroyed. A tank, one BBM, seven artillery systems and nine cars were damaged. In the Kurakhiv direction, the enemy made 20 attempts to break through our defense near Zhelany Drugy, Tsukuryny, Georgiyivka, Kostyantynivka, Katerynivka, and Hirnyk. Thirteen skirmishes have been completed, seven more are still ongoing. In this direction, according to preliminary data, the enemy lost 100 people as irreversible and wounded. Four armored combat vehicles were also destroyed. In the Vremivsk direction, the enemy attacked our units five times near Ugledar, Katerynivka, and Vodyanyi. One attack by the occupiers is still ongoing. In the Orikhov direction, the invading troops stormed the positions of the Defense Forces near Robotyny, Novoandriivka, and Novodanilivka four times. One battle is still going on. There are no significant changes in the rest of the directions. The operation in the Kursk region is ongoing. Enemy aviation continues to attack its villages and cities with guided aerial bombs.

Title: Rustem Umyerov: The partners have never ruled out the possibility of long-range strikes on Russia
Description: The Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Rustem Umyerov, made optimistic forecasts regarding the solution to this issue during the broadcast of the telethon. -The only news-. According to the Minister of Defense, Western partners have never claimed that this is impossible. Instead, they are immersed in internal decision-making processes to obtain the necessary approvals. Rustem Umyerov emphasized that Ukraine has good relations with all allies and is ready to wait for the final decision. -We were never told it was impossible. Our partners are focused on operational issues and need permissions to stay on the -safe side,- explained the head of the Ministry of Defense. Rustem Umyerov also noted that in some countries it is necessary to go through complex internal procedures, including approval by the parliament or the National Security and Defense Council. In addition, the victory plan of President Volodymyr Zelenskyi, which he intends to present to Western leaders in September, provides for the right of Ukraine to decide independently how to use the weapons provided to it. As ArmiyaInform reported, there are already agreements on the transfer of F-16 and Migare. Continuing negotiations on Gripen and Eurofighter Typhoon fighters.

Title: Gives a second life to radios: the story of the signalman Phoenix
Description: Maksym was born in Boryspil district near Kyiv and has the nickname -Phoenix-. After all, it gives a second life to technology. He was involved in electronics almost all his life, his father gave Maksym a soldering iron for his 10th birthday, and even then he became interested in repairing household appliances. That is why the boy managed to find a job in the army. Currently, he repairs and restores communication equipment that is out of order after enemy fire. He joined the Defense Forces on the first day of the large-scale invasion, while the boy notes that he planned to go not to the army, but to the enterprise of the military-industrial complex. — But on February 24, they brought me a summons, and already at 6:00 p.m. I was in the unit. At the beginning, he served in the security company of the Boryspil TCC. There were tasks. And for a person who had never encountered the army, it was both difficult and difficult, and sometimes scary. And already in December 2022, he was transferred to the 110th separate mechanized brigade, says Maksym. Currently, -Phoenix- is the head of the repair shop at the field communications center, and together with his brothers, he provides communications to the headquarters and rear units. At the same time, his work is not limited to the 110th brigade, the young man explains that communication must also be provided to other units that are in the Pokrovsky direction. There is no big difference between civil and military electrical engineering, says a military officer. Therefore, he does not experience any additional difficulties during work. However, due to the dynamism of the war, it is quite often necessary to change the style of work, to get used to something new. — Yesterday we could also use Baofeng, but now we have completely forgotten about them. The work of the same FPVs, WEB frequencies also changes. The enemy started calculating the launch location of the Mavic, we rewrote the firmware so that there was no longer a link to the launch location. Changes take place extremely dynamically. And this adds a lot of work, but we are working, - added Maksym. Last year, the military man spent a lot of time at zero, and the tasks were diverse. It was necessary to deal with the towers, install transmitters for work to mislead the enemy or eavesdrop. -Phoenix- also launched broadcasts calling on the Russians to cease fire or offer to surrender. He also went to Avdiivka several times, which, according to the boy, he managed to bypass -along and across-. During the serious assaults on the city, Maksym worked alone in the workshop, and 10 Starlink terminals were brought to him almost every day. Then the boy slept for 3-4 hours, but he understood the importance of work. According to Maxim, the best way to explain the importance of communication in the military is by analogy with civilian life. When an ordinary person does not pick up his phone in the morning, does not start reading the news, watching various videos, then by the evening he will begin to feel a certain vacuum. — A vacuum, because she does not know what is being done in the white world, and what is being done behind the fence. And work chat, and with family, and so on. And now we're just adding to all of this a potentially life-threatening thing. Life is in danger, and you don't know which side the danger is coming from, the soldier explained. He clarifies that when there is communication, personnel can be warned of an enemy attack and this will help prepare for battle. Maxim calls the old -tapik- (military wire communication. — Ed.) the most secure means of communication in the army, which, although, according to him, has a large number of shortcomings, it cannot be eavesdropped by the enemy, which is very important during the war . — There was no modernization of all of this, the 1958 model -tapiks- were used. It can be made much smaller, it can be made much more interesting. Nevertheless, the warehouses are full of this good, it was picked up, washed a little, cleaned - and it works, said -Phoenix-. At the same time, he again emphasized that the war is changing rapidly, and that is why on the front -tapiks- are almost not used, and Motorola communication devices can be seen more often. - As for me, just subjectively, it seems to me that the hardest thing is when we move from one area to another and we have to simply lay everything out from scratch. There is such a thing that masters, like crayfish, carry the workshop with them under their tails. No matter how banal it is, but after the third move, everything is already unified for me. I have a folding table, I have a folding chair, everything is minimized. There shouldn't be too much in the workshop, the boy said. And the presence of the workshop itself makes it possible to save time when other fighters are forced to involve civilians in the repair of certain equipment. At the same time, -Phoenix- is also aware of the enemy's state of affairs. He specified that almost all Russian brigades work on the same equipment, but the quality of specialists is questionable. Also, a significant part of the occupiers, who are sent for meat assaults, are not provided with means of communication at all. However, the guy does not underestimate the capabilities of the Russians, because the occupying special forces have good means of radio-electronic warfare and radio-electronic intelligence. Maksym explained that at first glance it may seem that he is doing nothing, he is sitting in a chair in front of the computer, there is a soldering iron on the table, and there are various monitors in front of him. However, after the battle, the soldiers with whom he worked come to him and express their gratitude. This is the best reward for him. — For example, when guys from the front line come and say: -everything is clear on the communication.- This is very nice. When no one quarrels, that there is no connection, when the boys hear each other, then this is the most gratifying, the soldier added. The army taught Maxim more responsibility for himself, as well as for his subordinates, because in war mistakes are measured by people's lives. That is why, when he undertakes some work, he does it qualitatively and quickly. After the end of the war, -Phoenix- first of all wants to get on his motorcycle and ride 800 kilometers without stopping. The guy called his bike the best psychologist. — I really want that. I miss him so much. Sometimes such trash, so heavy. This is my desire after the war - to get on my bike and go on a motorcycle trip somewhere for at least a week. In the Carpathians, and maybe by the sea, somewhere where there are few people and only nature, Maxim emphasized. Dmytro Braslavskyi for ArmiyaInform Photo of the 110th separate mechanized brigade named after Corporal General Mark Bezruchka

Title: How the Russian peace fell into a fire trap in Belarus: a half-thousand-year history
Description: Volodymyr Hutsul, associate professor of the Department of Archaeology, Ecology and Cultural Studies of the Uzhgorod National University, told ArmiyaInform about the famous Battle of Orsha in 1514, in which the armies of European and Asian military traditions met. — The mention of the 510th anniversary of the Battle of Orsha is included in the -Ukrainian military-historical calendar for 2024-. However, this battle took place during the war between Lithuania and Muscovite on the territory of modern Belarus. A person who is not sufficiently familiar with Ukrainian history may have a question - what is Ukraine here for? - It is important to remember that Ukrainian history did not take place in a spherical vacuum. The processes that took place in Central-Eastern Europe in the 16th century influenced Ukrainian history and, accordingly, Ukrainian history had an impact on European history. Therefore, we should abandon Ukrainian historical isolationism and understand Ukrainian history in the context of European history. The Battle of Orsha in September 1514 is the culmination of the confrontation between two military and political powers in Eastern Europe, which gained strength at the beginning of the 16th century - the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and the Grand Duchy of Moscow. Then the Muscovites were on the rise, practicing good old Mongol expansionism combined with the ideas of Byzantine imperialism. At that time, the Ukrainian lands were at the center of the confrontation between these two powers, therefore the Battle of Orsha relates directly to Ukrainian history, is a part of it. —However, at least according to my observations, few people outside the professional community of historians know about the Battle of Orsha. Why so? Why was little attention paid to it before? — This is an old Soviet totalitarian historiographical tradition — to keep quiet not even certain events that are relevant for the history of Ukraine, but even entire periods. Or to present them as unimportant marginal plots from the point of view of Soviet totalitarian history. With such an approach, Moscow's defeats were tried to be hidden and not mentioned again. On the other hand, in the Belarusian national historiographical tradition, the Battle of Orsha is well known and quite popular. Not only because the events took place on Belarusian territory, but also because the battle is an important plot of the modern Belarusian national idea, which separates Belarusian history from Moscow history. —From what sources do we know about the Battle of Orsha? How informative are they? — Like most large-scale battles of the 16th century, the Battle of Orsay is fairly well documented. We can name several types of historical sources that inform us about the causes and background of an event, its participants, course and consequences. First of all, these are the military and fiscal documents of the Jagiellonian Court, which tell us about the expenses for the campaign of 1514: mercenaries, artillery, etc. In the so-called archive of the Radzyvils, we have a list of parts of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth that were sent on the campaign of 1514. Then we have the earliest reports of the Battle of Orsha, which is the Jagiellonian diplomatic correspondence with European and non-European monarchs. The most interesting, in my opinion, are visual sources. Several unique images have reached us about the Battle of Orsha. This is a woodcut from a eulogy in honor of Andrzej Krytski, published in Krakow in 1515, which contains the only portrait of Prince Konstantin Ostrozki during his lifetime. We also have a large painting depicting a battle, painted in the first third or perhaps even the first quarter of the 16th century. It is currently kept in the Warsaw National Museum. It is a large, original visual narrative of the battle, featuring up to a thousand characters. There are also visual sources of Moscow origin in the so-called Lytsovo Chronicle Vault - there are more than 10 illustrations dedicated to the Battle of Orsha. So we have a complex of sources both from the side of the losers and from the side of the winners. - What were the troops that gathered at Orsha? - We know much more about the Jagiellonian army than about the Moscow army. Based on documents, images and narrative messages, we can say that the Jagiellonian army was organized according to the latest European fashion. At that time, the military fashion in Western Europe was defined by the so-called Italian Wars - the conflict between the Valois and the Austrian Habsburgs over Italian heritage. It was these wars of the late 15th and mid-16th centuries that became a kind of laboratory of military technologies. Their main trend was to combine old-style heavy shock cavalry with small arms units. There is a stereotype that hand firearms almost immediately supplanted, destroyed or nullified the importance of knightly cavalry. In reality, this was not the case. It was the combination of firepower and shock cavalry that ensured the effectiveness of armies in the 16th century. If we talk about the formation of the army of that time in different countries, then the Grand Duchy of Lithuania relied on the common movement - the general military duty of the nobility. Nominally, at the request of the Grand Duke of Lithuania, every landed gentry had to join military service. However, at the beginning of the 16th century, this system did not work very effectively. It is this ineffectiveness of the system of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth that is the main reason for the series of defeats of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania in the war with the Muscovites, when Lithuania suffered significant territorial losses. On the other hand, in the Polish crown at that time, processes were taking place that balanced the general movement of the mercenary army - military specialists. At that time, this was also a pan-European trend - to supplement in different proportions or to try to replace the nobility common movement with mercenaries. - And what was the Moscow army like at that time - did it also develop according to European trends or did it have any peculiarities? - The Moscow army consisted mainly of the so-called local cavalry. These were also people who had military service for land grants from the Moscow prince. However, more than half - 50-60% - of the Muscovite army consisted of so-called combat serfs, or servants. These were dependent unfree people who were taken to the war by the landowners - the so-called boyar children. Compared with Europe, in particular with the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and the Kingdom of Poland, the Moscow military elite had practically no rights and freedoms. Combat serfs did not even have what boyar children had. This greatly influenced both the worldview of representatives of the Moscow military community and their combat traditions and tactics on the battlefield. - That is, it directly affected tactical techniques? - As for military technology, the Moscow army was mainly composed of horse archers. It was borrowed from Eastern, Mongolian and Tatar tactics. The combination of shock heavy armored cavalry with fire infantry of the Muscovites to the extent that it was common in Europe was not practiced. Instead, the Jagiellonian army combined heavily armored plate cavalry, lighter cavalry with melee weapons - so-called hussars, mounted riflemen, light infantry and field artillery. This led to a wider range of tactics that such an army could use on the battlefield. - What was the number of troops on both sides? - There is a debate about this. There is an old narrative tradition dating back to the 16th century to count the Jagiellonian army at 30,000, and the Moscow army at 80,000 combatants. These figures are greatly exaggerated, because neither the Moscow principality at that time had such a resource, nor the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and the Polish crown. If we turn to the military and fiscal documentation, we can count about 12,000 soldiers in the Jagiellonian army near Orsha. There were about 7,000 boyar children in the Moscow army, each of whom had to be accompanied by at least one combat serf, that is, we have at least 14,000. At the same time, we have every reason to believe that there were more serfs - 2-3 with each boyar child. Accordingly, the total number of the Moscow army increases approximately twice - to 28-30 thousand. — However, with a numerical advantage, the Russian army lost the battle. How did this happen? — The battle began with a Moscow attack, then continued with a counterattack by the Lithuanian commonwealth movement. Attacks and counterattacks continued until the Jagiellonian army managed to lure part of the Muscovites under the muzzles of the fire infantry, which Prince Konstantin Ostrozky had prudently placed in an ambush. This ultimately determined the outcome of the battle. However, one should not forget the importance of heavy armored cavalry, the effectiveness of the new trend of combining it with fire infantry, and the combination of various battle tactics. All this tipped the scales in favor of the army under the command of Prince Konstantin Ostrozky. - Was this battle significant in the short and long term? - The main goal of the Jagiellonian campaign was not achieved - Smolensk was not recaptured. On the other hand, it was a heavy and even catastrophic defeat of the Moscow army, which had enormous moral significance. Both for the social capital of the Jagiellonian monarchy and for the political capital, it was then believed that God himself sided with the victors, granting victory in the battle. The third point was that after the battle of Orsha, the Muscovites avoided open clashes with the Jagiellons in the field for a long time, until the Livonian War. The war after the Battle of Orsha lasted until 1522, but no more major battles took place in the field. Many representatives of the Moscow military elite died and were captured in the battle. The nobles of the Grand Duke of Muscovite—the elite part of the Muscovite military—suffered heavily. Another part of Muscovites was captured and transported around Europe, showing the European rulers a kind of traveling circus or a menagerie of captured savages from the East. Thanks to this, the Europeans were able to see the wild Muscovites with their own eyes.

Title: Ratification of the Rome Statute: benefits and risks for the military
Description: Actually, the path from signing to ratification of the Rome Statute in Ukraine was quite long - almost 25 years. And all this time, passions around the document did not abate. First, the President of Ukraine Leonid Kuchma, who ordered the signing of the Rome Statute, already in 2001 submitted an appeal to the Constitutional Court with a request to declare it unconstitutional. The Constitutional Court of Ukraine then came to the conclusion that the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court, signed on behalf of Ukraine on January 20, 2000, does not correspond to the Constitution of Ukraine, in the part that refers to the provisions of the tenth paragraph of the preamble and Article 1 of the Statute, according to which the -International Criminal Court- ; complements the national bodies of criminal justice-. Subsequently, after the signing of the Association Agreement with the European Union in 2014, the ratification of this document became one of Ukraine's direct international obligations. However, the Ukrainian authorities were in no hurry to fully join the work of the International Criminal Court. ArmyInform asked lawyers to tell more about the International Criminal Court and explain what the ratification of the Rome Statute means for Ukraine and what risks it entails, in particular, for the Ukrainian military. — The idea of ​​creating an international court as a tool to prevent military conflicts and quickly punish the guilty arose after the Second World War, says Honored Lawyer of Ukraine Yevhenii Solodko. — After negotiations, the case did not move for almost 50 years, but the brutal war and genocide in Yugoslavia and Rwanda became a kind of catalyst for the process. At the UN diplomatic conference held in Rome on July 17, 1998, 120 states agreed to create the International Criminal Court. The document that regulates the work of the ISS became the -Rome Statute-, which was signed by the representatives of these states. The ICC was supposed to punish genocide, crimes against humanity (systematic murders, torture, kidnapping, etc.) and war crimes (attacks on civilian infrastructure, humiliation of the enemy, depriving prisoners of war of the right to a fair trial, etc.). A total of 137 countries have signed the ICC Statute, and 124 countries have ratified it. The ISS is located in The Hague, it began its work four years after the signing of the Charter, when it was ratified by the first 60 states. Yevgeny Sweetko says that there are countries that have even withdrawn their signature under it. This, for example, was done by the USA in May 2002. President George W. Bush said at the time that the International Criminal Court threatened the U.S. military and violated national sovereignty. China, India, Turkey, Egypt and Israel have also not signed or ratified the statute. Currently, the -Rome Statute- has been ratified by Ukraine, but the question arises - what does this ratification mean for us? — The International Criminal Court will be able to bring a Ukrainian to justice only if the national law enforcement system -cannot- or -does not want- to do it properly, explains Yevhenii Solodko. — If there is already a verdict of the Ukrainian Themis regarding a specific war crime - guilty or acquittal - then international justice is of no use here, because in Article 17 of the -Rome Statute- contains a list of reasons when an international court cannot accept a case for its proceedings. The main one is if the case is already being investigated by national law enforcement agencies. But the ICC can recognize that a national investigation was conducted improperly or specifically for the purpose of -protecting a person from persecution.- In this case, the international court can accept the case before its proceedings. He is convinced that states unfriendly to Ukraine, primarily the Russian Federation, will try to -throw- at the ISS with hundreds of statements against the military of the Armed Forces. Despite the fact that in November 2016, Russian President Vladimir Putin banned the ratification of the Rome Statute by decree. This happened after the ICC prosecutor's office began a preliminary investigation into the situation in Ukraine after 2014. Let me remind you that in 2008, when the Russian Federation started a war against Georgia, it submitted statements against Georgian political and military figures to the International Criminal Court. The Georgian authorities, in turn, filed lawsuits against Russia. The court spent 10 years investigating the situation, and ultimately punished only three officials of the unrecognized South Ossetia, but not Russia, which controlled them. Certainly, the ratification of the -Rome Statute- is one of the conditions for further European integration of Ukraine. All members of the European Union are members of the ISS. -This is a clear signal that Ukraine shares the principles of the international order based on laws and rules, and is fully ready to act in accordance with these principles,- Prosecutor General Andriy Kostin said. He also emphasized that Ukrainian prosecutors already cooperate with the Office of the Prosecutor of the International Criminal Court on a daily basis, and ratification will only strengthen this cooperation. After completing the procedure of joining the ICC, Ukraine will have the right to appoint its own judge to this international body, participate in prosecutor elections, and approve the distribution of the court's budget. Full participation in the ICC will make it easier for Ukrainians to access the court's special trust fund and increase the chances of receiving compensation for victims of Russian crimes. Lawyer Oleksiy Novikov names five main advantages of the ratification of the -Rome Statute-: Oleksiy Novikov explains: In general, our experts agree that the ratification of the Rome Statute is an important step for ensuring international justice and protecting human rights.

Title: Fake -confessions-: propaganda has once again started the old trick about drug addicts
Description: The Center for Strategic Communications and Information Security reminds us of this. In order to record the desired -picture-, the prisoners are forced under pressure and threats to voice the dark propaganda. This time, propagandists spread lies about narcotic substances that dull fear, reduce pain and increase courage. Drugs allegedly used by the soldiers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine are supplied to the Ukrainian army, including from the United States. This is a very old propaganda fiction. Do you remember the -spiked oranges- of the Orange Revolution and the fakes about the drug-addicted President of Ukraine that have been circulating since 2019? Now, allegedly from the words of a Ukrainian prisoner of war, propagandists are spreading lies about Ukrainian drug-addicted soldiers. But in this case, the fake was launched on behalf of an unidentified person (surname, rank, type of military, affiliation to a military unit, etc. are missing), so it may not even be a real prisoner of war, but a dummy person. By spreading such nonsense, Russian propaganda tries to discredit the Armed Forces in the eyes of conscripts and Ukrainian society in general.

Title: Rustem Umerov on the transfer of F-16: We will be able to announce the results soon
Description: This was stated by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov on the air of the telethon. According to him, Ukraine is currently negotiating with allies, explaining how many aviation brigades and planes we need. The authorities also tell partners about what weapons are needed to strengthen the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -Last year we focused on training pilots, obtaining platforms and building infrastructure. This year, we are working on achieving an advantage in the sky,- Rustem Umyerov said. The head of the defense department noted that Russia currently uses up to 300 aircraft and the same number of helicopters in the war against Ukraine, which poses a serious challenge to the Ukrainian military. Rustem Umyerov also emphasized the importance of scaling up negotiations with partners regarding the increase in aviation, informing about solutions currently being worked on. -There are already agreements on the transfer of F-16 and Migare. Negotiations are ongoing regarding the Gripen and Eurofighter Typhoon fighters. Soon there will be results that we will be able to announce,- the Minister of Defense emphasized. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine plans to produce several million drones by 2025. First of all, so that Russia does not have the opportunity to lead in this component.

Title: Minister of Defense: in 2025, Ukraine will surpass Russia in the production of drones
Description: stated this by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov on the air of the telethon -Edyny Novyni- -. The head of the defense department noted that even this year our country will purchase more than a million drones. Rustem Umerov estimated his own production at several million. -For our part, we did not say how many drones we can produce. But it's a few million. Of which some things are financed by the state budget, some money we find from partners. That is, our capacity is several million drones, we are able to do it. Next year, we will not let the enemy bypass us, so we will produce several times more,- the Minister of Defense noted. As reported by ArmyInform, for the first time Ukrainian companies will be able to take part in the Drone Coalition's tenders.

Title: Enemy attack aircraft will cry - the Vampire UAV crew about their work
Description: A video of a conversation with drones appeared on September 21 on the brigade's channel. The Ukrainian Vampire strike drone can carry up to 15 kg over a total distance of up to 30 km. And it often brings Russians unpleasant, and even the last surprises in their worthless lives. ArmyInform talked about <a href=-https://armyinform -. .

Title: Scorched earth tactics: in Kurshchyna, Russians wipe their own villages from the face of the earth
Description: Vadym Mysnyk, the spokesman of OTU -Siversk-, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- . — They have such a tactic that they do not distinguish at all which is Ukrainian territory and which is actually Russian. Their only tactic is simply scorched earth — they erase settlements from the face of the earth and they cannot use any new tactics, he said. He said that over the past day, the Russian military dropped 17 anti-tank missiles on the territory of the Sumy region and 25 anti-tank missiles on the part of the Kursk region controlled by units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. — Such ratios are practically preserved. That's why we moved the hostilities to their territory, the spokesman said. He also emphasized that the Kursk operation made it possible to protect the border regions of the Sumy region from shelling from mortars and artillery. Unfortunately, the Russians can launch more long-range weapons, primarily attack UAVs and anti-aircraft missiles, from deep within their own territory and hit Ukrainian populated areas in this way. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that part of the residents of the Kursk Oblast -have become enlightened- and they no longer believe Russian propaganda.

Title: -Vrut on TV!- - part of the residents of the Kursk region -seemed-
Description: This was told by Vadim Mysnyk, the spokesman of OTU -Siversk- on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- . — Russia reflects in its propaganda what it does and has done. By turning it over, they show it and want to turn it over to the Defense Forces of Ukraine, to Ukrainian soldiers. But it no longer works here, he said. Most of the -heroes- of materials fabricated by Russian propagandists are well known to the Ukrainian military. - The fact is that we know a lot about all the characters in these edited videos, because we communicate a lot with the local population, - the spokesman explained. In order for Russian propaganda to stop working, it is enough to show it to those who can see the real state of affairs on the ground with their own eyes. This is exactly what is happening to local residents in the Kursk region of the Russian Federation. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that residents of Kurshchyna are considered traitors in the Russian Federation.

Title: Brutal murder of a girl by the Russians in Nikopol: doctors are fighting for the life of another chi...
Description: This was reported by the head of Dnipropetrovsk OVA Serhii Lysak. In addition, two people were injured - a 4-year-old girl and a 25-year-old man. -These are the consequences of the enemy attack on Nikopol. Inhumans shot a kamikaze drone at a car in which there were people,- said the head of the OVA. According to Serhiy Lysak, the victims were hospitalized. The baby is -difficult-. All the necessary medical assistance is provided to both of them. As reported by ArmyInform, all day from Nikopolshchyna - the district center, Chervonogrigorivska, Myrivska, Pokrovska and Marganetska communities suffered enemy terror. There have been about 20 attacks since the morning — by artillery and drones.

Title: The President noted the successes of the Defense Forces in destroying Russian arsenals of tactical m...
Description: About this goes in the evening address of the head of state. He emphasized that these well-aimed strikes significantly affect the course of the war, because they destroy Russian stockpiles of weapons used for terror against Ukraine. -We are able to bring the war back home, to Russia,- Volodymyr Zelenskyi noted. According to him, the Armed Forces, the Security Service and all those involved in this work are making significant progress in destroying the enemy's arsenals. Particularly effective were the strikes on the caches of tactical missiles and guided aerial bombs, which the Russians use to attack Ukrainian cities and positions. The head of state emphasized the importance of supporting partners, in particular in the provision of long-range weapons, which can significantly speed up the end of the war. Ukraine continues to convince global partners of the need to provide means to protect against Russian terror. The President also noted the bravery of Ukrainian units fighting both on the front line and on enemy territory, in particular in the Kursk region of Russia. He expressed special thanks to the 46th separate airmobile brigade, the 68th Yeger brigade named after Oleksa Dovbush and the 425th separate assault battalion for their bravery in the Pokrovsky direction. Volodymyr Zelenskyy added that the next week could be decisive in the fight against Russian aggression, calling on partners to take decisive action to achieve victory and return to normal security. -Our clear strategy will be on the partners' table. With the President of the United States,- he summed up. As reported by ArmyInform, the Defense Forces of Ukraine two military arsenals and a North Korean echelon hit Russia.

Title: The Ministry of Defense plans to recruit civilian psychologists to the ranks of the Armed Forces
Description: Acting head of the Department Valentyn Obolentseva told about the department's key plans for the coming periods. -We aim to introduce quality psychological selection at the TCC level to determine where a soldier can best prove himself and which brigades will be most suitable for his service. This will help to use human capital effectively,- said Valentina Obolentseva. It is also planned to attract civilian psychologists to the ranks of the Armed Forces. According to Valentina Obolentseva, such specialists will be retrained to work as military psychologists, after which they will be able to hold officer positions. -This is an important step to provide our units with skilled psychological support,- she added. Title: The prosecutor's office named who was behind the torching of military vehicles

Curators look for performers through Telegram channels and at first give an easy task, for example, to put up flyers. And then they proceed to the arson order. The vast majority of performers, about 90%, have a selfish motive - the desire for easy money. For such crimes, they offer from 700 to 3 thousand dollars. But I don't remember a case where the performer received the offered amount. Law enforcement agencies promptly respond to such cases. 196 criminal proceedings have already been initiated and 169 paliyams have been notified of suspicion. Title: They fought in hysterics: in Kurshchyna, the locals did not believe the films about the crimes of th...

At the same time, informational work was organized for those local residents who said they knew nothing about Russia's attack on Ukraine and the crimes of the Russian occupiers on the territory of Ukraine. — While communicating, we immediately began to explain, to show those who said that they do not know what is happening in Ukraine, what kind of war it is. The reaction of the residents of Kurshchyna was different - some categorically did not believe what was shown and refused to look at the evidence of war crimes by the Russian military. - They couldn't believe it, some were in hysterics, some didn't want to watch at all. Apparently, they still knew, because they have family ties in Ukraine. Now they can't believe it, because they were completely brainwashed by propaganda, said Vadym Mysnyk. Title: A survey on the level of satisfaction with dry rations was launched in the Army+ application
