Title: A cavalcade of diplomats to China, the Taliban and why the collapse of the Russian Federation: an ex...
Description: These questions were answered by military expert Petro Chernyk. — The process of finding a formula for exiting this phase has begun. The most striking sign and argument for this is the so-called summit in Switzerland. A lot of countries gathered there, they simply wouldn't have gathered if they didn't understand some logic of the development of events, says the expert. And he notes that this process cannot be fast: - I really like historical parallels. Let's say the Americans have been negotiating with the Taliban for more than a year. Agreed, but it lasted over a year! This is despite the fact that the stakes in Ukraine and the US stakes with the Taliban are completely out of proportion. Chernyk calls the huge cavalcade of diplomats from Europe to China a second serious sign that the process of finding a way out of this war has begun. — And most importantly, Lavrov recently made a series of statements that they do not need foreign territories, that they are fighting for some Russian people who speak Russian, for the so-called Russian peace. But could there be a trap (in possible negotiations. — Ed.)? Maybe, says a military expert. And he notes that history knows many similar cases: - The brightest, the closest to us, is the Cyprus problem of 1974. Then the Turks invaded Cyprus, formed their own republic, which no one recognizes. And two large countries, primarily the United States and Great Britain, resolved this issue. But the conflict was not resolved by itself, there is no solution to it until now. Can something similar happen with the Ukrainian issue? According to Petr Chernyk, maybe. — I really don't like the word -freeze- because our conflict cannot be frozen for such a long time. There is a high probability that some new demarcation formula will be found. Of course, no one recognizes those territories in the civilized world. A large international contingent is also possible. Why not? It is only important that there are not many Russian proxies there, because they are, say, on the African or Latin American continents, the military expert emphasizes. According to him, in the future, as soon as Russia enters a breathing mode, sanctions may be partially lifted from it, and the possibility of the next Russian-Ukrainian war is only a matter of time: - But again, there is one more very important nuance. This is dangerous and not the best scenario for us, but the Russians have not achieved the most important goal. They did not liquidate Ukrainian statehood. Ukrainian state to be… And we will truly calm down only when the Russian Federation breaks up into 25-30 states, their nuclear weapons are taken away, they are cut off from free resources in Siberia, and the population that will remain around Moscow undergoes the so-called sanitization - ideological cleansing. The same as the Nazis went through after World War II. Chernyk names our further accession to NATO or the formation of a direct military alliance with the USA as an option. — If this does not happen, even if we find a very acceptable formula for us, then the issue of the Russian-Ukrainian war will only be a matter of time. As Bolshevik Lenin said: -Losing Ukraine is like losing your head.-

Title: How reports are prepared at OTU -Kharkiv-: about Telegram, news reports from the front line and the ...
Description: The modern war of Russia against the Ukrainian people and the state of Ukraine is sometimes called the most documented and represented in the media in the history of mankind. Media coverage of hostilities plays a colossal role in shaping public opinion about the war in Ukraine and abroad, and influences public attitudes and policies of foreign partners. ArmiyaInform spoke with Colonel Vitaly Sarantsev, spokesman for the operational-tactical group -Kharkiv-, about the information component of modern warfare. The first part of the interview: Kharkivshchyna as a friend of Syria: the spokesman of the OTU -Kharkiv- called the most despicable purpose of the application KABs. — On the Telegram channels of Ukrainian units and individual military units, and following them in the Ukrainian media, videos are often shared not only of destroyed equipment or positions of the occupiers, but also of liquidated enemy personnel. On the one hand, this is a demonstration of the effectiveness of the combat work of the defenders of Ukraine. On the other hand, there are accusations about the inhumanity of the distribution of such videos, and in some cases they even try to talk about violations of international law, laws and customs of war. How justified are such criticisms of the Ukrainian military? Can the published video recordings be used against the Defense Forces of Ukraine? - Several main points should be taken into account here in order to maintain a very shaky balance between the appropriateness of placing this or that publication and the impropriety, so to speak. On the one hand, the video that demonstrates the effectiveness of our defenders is a kind of message to society that the army is fighting and winning. This is also a kind of report to our citizens who help the Defense Forces with donations. Also, these videos show the average Russian occupier that he could be the next victim. At the same time, posting on information resources video clips depicting the bodies of the dead or the suffering of the wounded may be considered a violation of international humanitarian law, in particular, norms on respect for human dignity or rules for treating the wounded. Everyone who is involved in the work in the information sphere, be it television, news sites, or channels in social networks, has a special responsibility for how they talk about war, because the constant promotion of such content can lead to the desensitization and normalization of violence in society. It should be remembered that every word, every photo, every video frame has weight, especially in wartime. Before disseminating any information, the media person should be aware of its potential consequences. Can it be used by the enemy and how? Will it harm the morale of our defenders? Will it cause panic among civilians? We must be responsible for every word, because not only our reputation, but also the fate of the country depends on it. — I agree, but sometimes one gets the impression that accusations of inhumanity or violations of international law against the Ukrainian military are excessively scrutinizing, especially against the background of what the Russian occupiers openly indulge in and brag about — murders, torture, indiscriminate shelling, or even special targeting destruction of residential buildings, educational and medical facilities, energy facilities etc. One gets the impression that the aggressor is allowed to do everything - he and the aggressor, his crimes have already become a general characteristic of the occupier, and therefore no one is interested. Whereas Ukrainians are forced to fight -in white gloves- - there is such meticulous, increased attention to us. - Indeed, a certain cognitive disparity is visible: on the one hand, we feel the war crimes of the Russian Federation, which has already become the norm for everything of the world, and on the other hand, increased demands are being made to Ukraine regarding compliance with international humanitarian law. For many, this gives rise to a sense of injustice and double standards. But it should be remembered that one of the rules of International Humanitarian Law is non-reciprocity or non-response to wrongful actions of the enemy. This means that respect for the laws of war does not depend on the actions of an enemy who does or does not follow the same rules. The laws of war must be respected at all times, regardless of the actions of the enemy. That is, if the Russians shelled Okhmatdyt, it does not mean that we have the right to shell some children's hospital in the Russian Federation. The rule -an eye for an eye- does not apply here. Therefore, our task is to spread true information about the war and the crimes of the Russian Federation, involve foreign media, involve international organizations in the investigation of these war crimes. In any case, we must adhere to international humanitarian law, even in spite of provocations by the enemy, because, among other things, this is also an important factor in obtaining international support, including military aid. - One more related question. The Armed Forces of Ukraine are hitting enemy positions, including across the border, on Russian territory. But sometimes we get the impression that our territory is being hit regularly, constantly, a lot, and we do not strike back or hit very little, because we were forbidden by the Western allies, we were not given ammunition, etc. Is it even necessary to talk about the fact that the armed forces are also inflicting fire damage on the territory of the Russian Federation? - The enemy must be destroyed wherever he is. Russia has attacked us and is waging an aggressive war of aggression under a fictitious pretext. the Russians seek to destroy the Ukrainian state and the Ukrainian people. We know how cruel the enemy is in his actions, without any moral and ethical restraints. Therefore, it should be destroyed, in particular, on its own territory. According to international law, every state has the right to self-defense. Russia is the aggressor and is fully responsible for all the destruction and casualties on both sides. And of course we have to talk about it. — Quite often, Ukrainian media disseminate information about the situation at the front with an appeal to foreign sources, which are perceived as more authoritative and reliable than Ukrainian ones. For example, reports citing the daily reports of the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) as a primary source have become very popular since the beginning of the large-scale invasion. At the same time, it is not difficult to notice that in many cases the institute's report is reduced to a simple recording and transfer of information from open sources, including official data of the Defense Forces of Ukraine — operational information regarding the Russian invasion of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, information messages of operational-strategic and operational-tactical groups troops, speeches of officially authorized spokespeople, etc. Why is this happening, why do our media people often cite ISW as a primary source even where the institute's report simply repeats official reports? - The Institute for the Study of War is an authoritative resource that analyzes the situation based on open data. However, its reports are often based on a large amount of information from different sources, which may change or be incomplete. At the same time, ISW does not distinguish between official and unofficial sources and very often uses propagandistic Russian materials in its analysis. To the credit of its analysts, they always cite the sources of information, providing a list of everything they used in the preparation of the report. But some of our media probably need to be scolded in this matter, because they perceive the information reported by the Institute as a given. For some reason, it is believed that if certain information is published by ISW, then it means that it has real confirmation and acquires official status. As a result, they sometimes present society with a distorted picture of events. I believe that this is unacceptable. In addition, it undermines our work, the work of the official communication channels of the military-political leadership of the state, the work of communicators of the Armed Forces and the Defense Forces in general. We are conducting a defense operation in which every action, including public information, must be subordinated to the interests of defense. Using unverified information, even from such a powerful resource as the Institute for the Study of War, can unwittingly play along with the enemy. - Can you open the veil of secrecy a little, how a regular daily information message is prepared in Kharkiv OTU? - During the day, we receive information from the areas of the front, from all the brigades that perform combat tasks in our operational-tactical group . Of course, we also work in units during trips. We work with data provided by intelligence. It should be taken into account that the war is very dynamic, the course of hostilities is very fluid. Therefore, in order not to harm our troops, certain information, of course, does not go to the general public, but we organize other information into a daily summary. We may provide some information with a delay, for example, it refers to those moments when we have made some progress or reached new milestones. — And do you take information from any Russian propaganda resources? Do you monitor them? - Of course. Monitoring of the information space, including that of the enemy, continues around the clock. We intercept all information related to the course of hostilities. We, of course, analyze how the enemy presents news and what he talks about. Now we can conclude that the depopulation of Ukrainians — and not only the military, but also civilians — on Russian propaganda resources has reached the point where calls for the total genocide of the entire Ukrainian people are already being presented as something completely commonplace and something that should not arouse in Russians no objections. -Nazis- for Ukrainians is perhaps the most moderate option, there are many much worse ones. The use of such radical images not only incites hatred, but also creates a hostile atmosphere that makes genocidal actions against Ukrainians acceptable in the eyes of Russian society. — But these media can be read by Ukrainian media professionals and ordinary readers. What advice would you give them when they accidentally or purposefully go to an enemy resource? How to work with the information received from there? - The most important thing is that you don't have to go there at all. There are many interesting and useful information resources, both domestic and foreign. Russian ones do not belong to them. But if you still got there, then I advise you not to fall into -betrayal-, because the entire information module on Russian propaganda resources is built in such a way that it can cause panic in an unprepared reader. It should be understood that these channels are propaganda, that they present a distorted reality, and it will be very difficult for an untrained reader to read this or that information. In general, it is important to maintain critical thinking and observe certain rules of safety and media hygiene. —Most of the Russian propaganda resources available to the Ukrainian reader work on the Telegram platform. Since the beginning of the large-scale war, there has even been a certain phenomenon of the so-called Zyu-voenkors, who, of course, are not any military correspondents, but act purely as propagandists of the aggressive war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, providing its media support. Telegram is very popular in Ukraine, but it has a lot of frankly manipulative channels and hostile propaganda, so it is increasingly believed that it can be dangerous for the national security of Ukraine. So what to do with Telegram in Ukraine? - In my opinion, we should not abandon Telegram or ban it. Banning such platforms may resemble the actions of authoritarian regimes, where control over information is used to suppress dissent. However, its status needs to be determined. Is it messenger or media? If it is a media, then its activities must comply with Ukrainian legislation that regulates the media sector. This means that it must comply with requirements regarding the reliability of information, countering propaganda and protecting national security. This issue needs to be clearly defined at the legislative level to avoid abuse and to ensure both freedom of speech and safety. In addition, a clear definition of the status will make it possible to establish who is responsible for the content that is distributed through Telegram channels. In general, in matters of the functioning of not only Telegram, but also social networks, Ukraine should -show its teeth- more often. We must have strong legislation and tools to monitor, regulate and, if necessary, control platforms that can be used to undermine our country's sovereignty or spread harmful information. —You mentioned the Kursk region, and in continuation of the information topic, I also want to ask about the Russian prisoners of war who were captured by the Defense Forces. It is noticeable that Russian propaganda has strengthened allegations that Ukrainians treat prisoners cruelly, on the one hand, and is trying to increase hatred of the Russian military among Ukrainians, on the other. - This is true. The case with the 155th Marine Corps Brigade of the Russian Federation, when they set the head of a Ukrainian soldier on a stake and bragged about it on video, proves just that. Of course, this provoked quite outrageous comments on social networks, with calls for the same treatment of Russian prisoners. The propagandists of the Russian Federation collect all these posts (made, in particular, not by Ukrainians themselves, but by Russian bots) and use them for information and propaganda work both among civilians and among the Russian military. In this way, they show, they say, this is what will happen to those who surrender to captivity. Such work with the Russian military has certain fruits - some of them prefer to self-destruct - shoot themselves, blow themselves up with a grenade or even strangle themselves with an Esmarch tourniquet - than surrender to captivity. - But at the same time, there are reports in the Ukrainian media from brigades about how wounded Russian servicemen surrender as prisoners - Yes, this happens, and it has been happening, in particular, in our direction, since May more than 50 Russian occupiers surrendered as prisoners. Among the vivid cases, there was a report from the -Charter- brigade about how Ukrainian fighters, with the help of a drone, threw water and a note with instructions on how to surrender to a wounded Russian to a wounded Russian. Then he was taken to Ukrainian positions by drone, and everything was fine with him. In general, Ukrainians treat prisoners in a civilized manner, this cannot even be compared with the conditions in which our prisoners of war in the Russian Federation find themselves - it is enough to compare the appearance of prisoners during exchanges. —In fact, sometimes it is very surprising when Russian propagandists and Russian users of social networks are outraged by reports about the rescue of Russian soldiers, about the fact that they are being taken prisoner. Why does it cause such hatred in them that the Ukrainians saved their military man? - Here, probably, it is a matter of their mentality as a whole. Heroic death is cultivated in Russia. This goes back at least since World War II. A prime example is Stalin's infamous Order No. 227 -let's take a step back.- Surrender is considered something shameful, if a person surrendered even wounded and unable to continue fighting, they still consider him a traitor and a criminal, even his closest relatives disown him very often. This attitude towards prisoners in Russian society also prompts their soldiers to die or lay hands on themselves, but not to surrender. The Russian command constantly warms this attitude. It is in our Kharkiv direction that cases are known when the commanders of the occupiers read order No. 227 in front of the formation, using it as an additional motivational tool. This, by the way, shows that the Russians identify the events of the Second World War with the events that are happening now. They believe that they are continuing the heroic struggle against fascism and Nazism, etc. They connect all this into a single whole with modern events. This simplifies the perception of the conflict by Russians, because they are forced to believe that Ukraine is not a victim of aggression, but a continuation of the same -fascism- that their grandfathers fought against. The very reports about our humane treatment of Russian prisoners destroy the image of bloodthirsty -Nazis- they created for Ukrainians. When it turns out that this is not true, it makes them extremely angry. This breaks the picture that Russian propagandists have been creating for their fellow citizens for decades about Ukraine and Ukrainians. — In your opinion, do the Ukrainian media cope with keeping the propaganda blow from the Russian Federation and at the same time competently informing the Ukrainian society? Do we win this war information or do we lose more? On the one hand, most Ukrainian media resist the flow of misinformation by the Russian Federation. For example, factual initiatives and independent journalistic projects significantly reduce the impact of Russian narratives within the country and beyond. It is also worth noting a certain increase in the level of media literacy of Ukrainian citizens. On the other hand, Russian propaganda, which has huge financial resources and media platforms, continues to be a threat, especially at the international level. As for the question of whether we win the information war, the answer is difficult. In many aspects, Ukraine has won important victories, in particular in shaping a positive international image and coverage of the truth about Russian aggression. However, Russian propaganda still affects certain audiences, especially in the west and in countries where Russian media have a strong position, so we all have a lot of work. By the way, literally it became known that the USA, Canada and the United Kingdom have launched a joint diplomatic campaign against sources of Russian influence in the world. In addition, the United States has imposed sanctions on the Russian propaganda channel of Russia Today and one of the main mouthpieces of the Kremlin Dmitry Kiselev. You can only congratulate these decisions, as this is another step towards our victory.

Title: the Russian IPSO attacks: why does the enemy lie about payments for the status of a child of war
Description: Yes, since the beginning of September, a video has been circulating there, which talks about the alleged entry into force of the new law No. 4995 on the status of -children of war-, according to which from September 1, 2024, children will receive 15 thousand hryvnias each month for three years. The video shows the website of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and screenshots from the Diya portal about the status of a child of war. The service identifier is 01199. In fact, this information is not true, it is distributed with the aim of misleading the public and increasing the degree of social tension in our state. Law No. 4995, which is referred to in video, was adopted back in 2017 and concerns the provision of housing for families of fallen ATO soldiers. In addition, according to with the service identifier 01199, it is indeed possible to obtain the status of -child of war-, but this only applies to persons who are citizens of Ukraine and who were less than 18 years old at the time of the end of the Second World War (September 2, 1945). State Propaganda Russia's apparatus uses TikTok to broadcast Kremlin narratives, spread disinformation, and IPSO. At the beginning of 2024, the social network even introduced restrictions on the distribution of content from the accounts of Russian propagandists. One of the most famous examples of Russian IPSO in TikTok, which is aimed at demoralizing Ukrainian society, are videos with allegedly Ukrainian military personnel and demotivating comments in them. . Text messages or a voiceover blame the Ukrainian authorities for all problems, not the Russian Federation, which is waging a terrorist war against our country. In this way, the enemy is trying to create a split within the society. In some cases, the Russians decorate real Ukrainian videos from the front in their own way, in others they try to pretend that they are showing servicemen of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, applying stickers in the form of chevrons, etc. The peak of the next wave of distribution of such videos coincided with the beginning of the mobilization campaign, so their goal was and remains the disruption of mobilization. Research shows that almost 20% of search results on TikTok contain fake or information that misleads users. Because of this, several countries around the world have already taken the initiative to ban this social network.

Title: Two in one: Poland has developed the newest UAV — a scout that can be an artilleryman
Description: As claim the developers of the aircraft from the Polish company WB Electronics, this UAV significantly expands the user's situational awareness, while giving him the ability to safely observe rapidly changing situations on the battlefield or in other environments, ArmyInform reports. One of the main features of X-FRONTER is the use of a military-grade encrypted communication line to control it. This technology provides stable communication protected from jamming attempts, which allows the drone to effectively perform reconnaissance and strike missions at a distance of several kilometers from the operator. With this level of protection, infantry units can rely on the X-FRONTER to conduct surveillance and precision attacks in difficult combat environments. The X-FRONTER is capable of carrying a small explosive payload, including thermobaric, fragmentation, and cluster warheads. This ability makes it not only a reconnaissance tool, but also an effective means of inflicting point strikes on the enemy. In addition, the design of the drone allows it to be easily adapted for different missions, including additional modules such as: infrared markers, devices for installing smoke curtains and other technical innovations. Another important technology implemented in X-FRONTER is the capability for swarm operations. This drone can work in a group with other drones, dividing tasks among themselves. For example, several X-FRONTERs can perform reconnaissance, while other drones equipped with explosives act as mobile artillery, striking the enemy. This greatly expands the tactical capabilities of infantry on the battlefield. The design of the drone from the Polish manufacturer in the folded state resembles a PET bottle in size and shape, which allows you to easily carry it with you. The drone is capable of reaching a speed of up to 60 kilometers per hour and a height of up to 300 meters. In the unfolded state, the X-FRONTER is quite a classic quadcopter, that is, a four-rotor aircraft with symmetrically located -shoulders- around a cylindrical fuselage. Its -hands- with stationary engines and propellers are hidden right in the hull, thanks to which both transportation and preparation for flight take place quickly and without problems, and the absence of protruding elements prevents them from being damaged during transportation. Flight time is up to 40 minutes, which gives infantry units considerable operational flexibility. This flight duration allows the drone to perform long missions, providing reliable support to troops in various situations. X-FRONTER is a versatile tool that can significantly increase the combat capabilities of infantry units. Thanks to its compact size, high mobility, encrypted communication and the ability to operate in swarms, this drone becomes indispensable for a wide range of tasks on the battlefield. The Polish developer presented a new compact and deadly X-FRONTER infantry drone. Video: Main Battle Tank

Title: The Defense Forces spoke about the tactics of the Russians in the Lymano-Kupian direction
Description: Officer Andrii Otchenash, commander of the Kara Nebesna UAV crew of the Rubizh brigade, told about this on the broadcast of the Yedyny Novyni telethon. According to him, the enemy moves mainly by infantry, and much less often by vehicles. -They use a huge number of personnel. In some places, technology is used, but not as brightly as it was before. They understand that as soon as they use a large amount of equipment, it will be destroyed immediately,- said the officer. He explained that the Russians are trying to move in small groups, accumulate at certain points and carry out further offensive actions. -For example, a group of 10 Russians moves, four arrive. They hide in dugouts, where it is more difficult to get them. Next comes the next group. They are all waiting to be replenished until they are collected enough for assault actions,- the officer noted. As reported by ArmyInform, today in the Kupyansk direction the enemy ;utm_medium=article&utm_campaign=traficsource->carried out seven assaults near Sinkivka and Lozova. Title: He provided the occupiers with transport and fuel: the director of the agricultural company will be ...

Since March 2022, the head of the enterprise deliberately established contact with representatives of the aggressor state and handed over the premises of the elevator building along with the equipment and other material assets available at that time to the enemy. The enemy's helper ensured the operation of the enterprise and organized the reception, drying, shipment and temporary storage of agricultural crops. In addition, the accused gave instructions to subordinate employees to refuel motor vehicles that were on the company's balance sheet, which he later also handed over to the armed forces of the aggressor state. An accomplice of the enemy performed his duties until the moment of deoccupation. Currently, he is hiding from Ukrainian law enforcement officers, he is declared wanted. The man will be tried in absentia for aiding the aggressor state. He faces up to twelve years of imprisonment with deprivation of the right to hold certain positions or engage in certain activities for a period of up to fifteen years and confiscation of property. Title: The Russian soldier who shot two residents of Buchi was declared a suspect
Description: This is stated in messages of the National Police. At the end of March 2022, an armed occupier detained a 75-year-old unarmed local resident without reason. Together with the hostage, he broke into the house of another Buchi resident without warning and demanded to give him alcohol and drink with him. The 63-year-old owner replied that he does not drink alcohol. The occupier did not accept the refusal and searched the kitchen, as a result of which he found alcohol, got angry and shot both residents of Buchi with automatic fire. The men died on the spot from their injuries. At that time, the sister and wife of the murdered owner were hiding in the next room and witnessed the murder of their family member and neighbor. They also told the investigators that later the Russian military came to them and buried the body of the owner of the house in the yard, and the body of another man was taken outside the territory of the house - a few weeks later his son found his body covered with leaves. The investigators of the National Police established the identity of the murderer. He is a 26-year-old native of the Altai Territory, a sniper of the 27th separate detachment of special forces -Kuzbass- (military unit 6607, Kemerovo) of the National Guard of the Russian Federation. Under the procedural guidance of the General Prosecutor's Office, he was informed of the suspicion of violating the laws and customs of war, combined with intentional murder (Part 2 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). He faces life imprisonment for war crimes committed on the territory of Ukraine.

Title: 221 medical facilities were completely destroyed by the occupiers since the large-scale invasion
Description: Sad statistics of losses for 30 months of the war reported in the Ministry of Health of Ukraine. Health care institutions of Kharkiv, Donetsk, Mykolaiv, Kyiv, Chernihiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Kherson and Zaporizhia regions suffered the greatest losses. It is currently impossible to obtain comprehensive information on the extent of the destruction of hospitals in the temporarily occupied territories. 221 medical institutions were completely destroyed and cannot be restored. In addition, the enemy destroyed 261 ambulances, damaged another 202, and captured 125. Despite the systemic circumstances and the burden on the health care system in Ukraine, recovery work has been ongoing since the first months of the full-scale war. For more than two years, 886 medical facilities have been fully and/or partially restored in different regions of Ukraine. Of them, 533 objects have been fully restored and another 353 - partially. These are medical facilities in the de-occupied territories, as well as those that suffered minor damage: broken windows, destruction of the roof, damage to the facade, etc. Most of the facilities were restored in Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Kyiv, Kharkiv and Chernihiv regions. Title: The Ministry of Defense allowed a Canadian armored car to be used in the Armed Forces
Description: This was reported by Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The Canadian-made Roshel Senator MRAP armored vehicle was codified and approved for use in the military by the Ministry of Defense. MRAP armored vehicles (from the English MRAP, Mine Resistant Ambush Protected – protection against mines and ambushes). Such machines have a V-shaped bottom to dissipate the energy of the explosion and special shock-absorbing seats. Structurally, they consist of a monolithic armored capsule and external explosion-absorbing units: wheels, chassis, engine. The latter absorb all the kinetic energy from the mine explosion, preserving the integrity of the residential module. The Roshel Senator armored car is designed on the chassis of the American Ford F-550 heavy pickup truck. Initially, the car was intended for the needs of the police. The model was improved for the needs of the Ukrainian army. The Roshel Senator MRAP received armor capable of protecting the crew and the landing party from bullets fired from small arms and debris. As well as a special V-shaped bottom, which dissipates the energy of a mine explosion or other explosive device equivalent to 6 kg of TNT. In addition, the Canadian armored car received a reinforced chassis, an all-wheel drive mechanism, and a 6.7-liter -omnivorous- turbodiesel with a capacity of more than 300 horsepower. In the configuration for the front, the car must also have a winch and a -night- light. Since the beginning of the large-scale invasion, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine has codified and approved for service in the army more than 20 armored vehicles of the MRAP class. Manufacturers and developers of OVT samples with additional questions regarding the process of product codification can contact the Main Directorate for Life Cycle Support of Weapons and Military Equipment by e-mail: mdalc@mil.ua

Title: A Russian Kh-101 missile was neutralized in Vinnytsia
Description: About this notified the National Police of Ukraine. The rocket was discovered by farmers in a field near one of the settlements. The fragments of the explosive object scattered over an area of ​​1 hectare, but the warhead still posed a danger to people. Also, during the inspection of the surrounding area, the law enforcement officers found cluster ammunition, which they neutralized on the spot. Employees of the Vinnytsia Oblast explosives service examined the fragments of the rocket, separated the warhead from the remains of the body and detonated the dangerous object in a specially equipped place. The police reminded that if any suspicious objects are found, it is not allowed to approach and touch them. It is necessary to report the find to the emergency services immediately.

Title: Minors who set fire to military vehicles were detained in Kyiv and Donetsk region
Description: This is stated in message of the SBU. The attackers -hunted- for SUVs of the Armed Forces, equipped for combat missions on the front line. First, those involved would find potential targets and coordinate them with their Russian handlers. Then they arrived at the parking lots of military vehicles and set them on fire with gasoline and flammable mixtures. For a -report- to the occupiers, those involved filmed the fire on their phone cameras, hoping for -easy money.- However, none of the arsonists did not wait for the promised money from the Rashists. A 16-year-old suspect who came from Cherkasy region to set fire to military vehicles in the capital was detained in Kyiv. For the -test- task, the young man had to burn an SUV that volunteers had purchased for one of the combat brigades of the Armed Forces of Ukraine fighting on the Eastern Front. In Donetsk region, a resident of Kramatorsk was detained, who also wanted to -make money- by setting fire to cars of the Defense Forces. Immediately, after the first attempt to destroy the Ukrainian soldier's SUV, the Security Service detained the young man and seized incendiary devices from him. Title: Dmytro Klimenkov: Denmark's investment in our defense industry is the key to strengthening Ukraine's...

Title: They pretended to be public activists and called for a coup: 50 people were detained
Description: About this inform September 16 in the Security Service of Ukraine. -They created dozens of informal associations and movements in our country and positioned themselves as supporters of -people's rule-. The perpetrators publicly called for a violent seizure of state power in Ukraine in order to support the armed aggression of the Russian Federation -from the inside,- the report says. Thanks to the Security Service of Ukraine, more than 30 of them have been reported on suspicion of crimes against national security. Another 14 defendants received actual prison terms and are currently serving their sentences. Thus, in Dnipro Oblast, law enforcement officers neutralized the subversive activities of the head of a pro-Kremlin cell and eight of his accomplices. During underground -conventions-, members of the -public organization- called for a coup d'état in Kyiv and discredited the Defense Forces. In Zaporizhzhia, five fake -people's power- bloggers were exposed, who, at the behest of the occupiers, were spreading misinformation about the activities of TCC employees. -To carry out information sabotage, the perpetrators used their own Telegram and YouTube channels, through which they made mass -throwbacks- against Ukrainian servicemen,- the SBU noted. Two enemy accomplices who organized video conferences with Russian propagandists and racist ideologues were convicted in Khmelnytskyi. During such online bridges, the participants called for the seizure of power in Kyiv with the subsequent -joining- of Ukraine to the Russian Federation. In Lviv region, law enforcement officers exposed two more supporters of the Kremlin regime, who publicly praised Putin and the occupation groups of the aggressor country. Dozens of exposed facts are being investigated to bring the perpetrators to justice for crimes against Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, law enforcement officers detained an Odesa citizen who was spying on the locations of Ukrainian military and defense enterprises in the region. The attacker was preparing coordinates for a new series of missile-drone strikes on Odesa.

Title: In Sumy Oblast, a shahed was shot down with small arms
Description: This was informed in the DPSU. After falling, the enemy drone did not detonate. The border guards showed a photo of the remains of the strike drone. As reported, on the night of September 16, 2024, the enemy ppo-zbyly-53-bpla/->attacked Ukraine with attack UAVs of the Shahed-131/136 type. The main direction of the attack is Kyiv region. As a result of anti-aircraft combat, 53 enemy attack UAVs were shot down in the Kyiv, Cherkasy, Vinnytsia, Poltava, Sumy, Zaporizhzhya, Kirovohrad, Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, and Cherkasy regions. Three more enemy drones were lost in location in several regions, previously without casualties or consequences.

Title: The chiefs of general staffs of NATO countries discussed strengthening support for Ukraine
Description: This is stated in a message on the NATO website. The military leaders of the Alliance countries discussed the creation of a new NATO command for security assistance and training for Ukraine. The new structure will allow NATO to supervise the training of the Ukrainian Armed Forces at training bases in the Alliance countries, support Ukraine through aid planning and coordination, manage the transfer and repair of equipment and provide support for the long-term development of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -Every day we are becoming more and more compatible. Until the day when we stand side by side under the NATO flag. Ukraine deserves our unceasing support,- said Admiral Rob Bauer, Chairman of the NATO Military Committee. Among other topics, the chiefs of the General Staff discussed the creation of the NATO Initiative for Security Assistance and Training for Ukraine and the launch of -nato-ukrayina-jatec-minoborony/->Joint NATO-Ukraine Analysis, Training and Education Center (JATEC).

Title: The pseudo-governor of the Kherson region was sentenced to 15 years in prison
Description: The Prosecutor General's Office reported this. The verdict of the court of the so-called governor of the Kherson region, who at that time was the head of the Kherson occupation military-civilian administration, sentenced him to 15 years of imprisonment. The other six members of the organized group were sentenced to 10 to 15 years in prison with confiscation of property. Prosecutors proved in court that the convicts went over to the side of the enemy in the temporarily occupied territories of the Kherson region and actively assisted the occupation authorities of the Russian Federation in providing postal, logistical, financial and trade needs. On the basis of integral property complexes of the Kherson directorate of JSC -Ukrposhta-, they created and ensured the operation of a pseudo-structure - the -state unitary enterprise -Kherson Post-. The convicts campaigned for the employees of JSC -Ukrposhta- to get a job before the illegal establishment, assuring them that the Russian occupation authorities would be there forever. As reported by ArmyInform, law enforcement officers detained an Odessa citizen who was scouting locations of Ukrainian military and defense enterprises in the region. The attacker was preparing coordinates for a new series of missile and drone strikes on Odesa.

Title: The hottest in Vovchansk: in the Kharkiv direction, the enemy has reduced activity in some places
Description: Vitaliy Sarantsev, the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv-, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni- . — As of today, the hottest part of the front is the Vovchan direction. This is directly the city of Vovchansk and the settlements adjacent to it. There, the enemy continues to attack the city, conduct street battles. There, he continues to try to wedge himself into the depth of our defense systems and inflict fire damage using a variety of weapons, he said. However, the occupiers face persistent resistance from units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine, which inflict losses on the enemy and force him to abandon his tasks. Thanks to the successful actions of the Ukrainian defenders, the Russian invaders were forced to reduce their activity and refuse to carry out assault actions in separate areas in the north of Kharkiv region. — If we take other directions, in particular, Staritsa, Liptsi, Hlyboke, Lukyantsi, the enemy is not currently conducting any active actions there. But this does not mean that he left and gave up the offensive. No, he is building up his forces, he is conducting an internal rotation of units. Where it is possible, he is trying to carry out logistical support measures, build up the communication system, build up the management system. This is evidence that he is still preparing to carry out offensive actions in certain directions with the aim of restoring the lost position, the spokesman noted. He emphasized that the Defense Forces, under favorable conditions, are trying to advance and advance, and also regularly inflict effective fire damage on the occupiers. — We are improving our own tactical position and little by little we are liberating our land from the Russian occupiers, Vitaly Sarantsev concluded. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that Vovchansk is under fire control, the occupiers trying to establish themselves mainly in the surrounding forests, instead in the city itself, the Russians shelled with RSZV own subdivisions in the area of ​​Aggregate Plant.

Title: Financed the production of arms of the Russian Federation through a business partner from Moscow: a ...
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about this on September 16. According to the investigation, after the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation into the territory of Ukraine, the director of one of the Kharkiv private enterprises continued to do business with a Russian company, in defiance of legal prohibitions. The entrepreneur continued to work with her business partner from Moscow. -Understanding that she will not be able to transfer the money to him, the accused engaged intermediaries. They became her acquaintances from the temporarily occupied territories, who can conduct financial transactions in the Russian Federation without hindrance,- the message says. In the period from May 2022 to April 2024, the woman sent money to their cards, and they were already able to transfer money directly to the partner's account in Moscow. ” The businesswoman's companion uses this money to pay taxes to the Russian budget, thereby ensuring the constant functioning of the military-industrial complex enterprise, primarily the missiles with which the enemy systematically fires at our state, law enforcement officers said. The Slobid district prosecutor's office of the city of Kharkiv approved and sent to the court an indictment against the 50-year-old director of a private enterprise for financing actions taken with the aim of changing the borders of the territory and the state border of Ukraine in violation of the order established by the Constitution of Ukraine, based on a prior conspiracy by a group of persons (part 3 of Article 110-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). The accused faces up to eight years of imprisonment with deprivation of the right to hold certain positions or engage in certain activities for a period of up to three years and confiscation of property. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that banker-spy was detained in Kharkiv.

Title: The enemy army lost more than 960 occupiers, special equipment and tanks in the East
Description: informs operational and strategic grouping of troops -Khortytsia-. The total losses of the Russian army in the area of ​​responsibility of the -Khortytsia- anti-aircraft missile defense system as of September 15, 2024 are: -The defense forces continue to actively inflict losses on the enemy's troops in manpower and equipment, exhaust the enemy along the entire line of combat engagement,- the message says. As reported by ArmyInform, last day losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1060 people. Also, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed 3 tanks, 8 armored combat vehicles, 14 artillery systems, one MLRS, 29 UAVs of operational-tactical level, 28 cars and 6 units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: Strengthened by 40%: the enemy intensified aerial reconnaissance in the Kharkiv region
Description: The enemy's goal was explained on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- the spokesman of the OTU -Kharkiv- Vitaly Sarantsev. - Enemy air reconnaissance increased by about 40%. He spends her both day and night. It should be noted that the adversary can thereby fulfill two purposes. The first is the identification of units of the Defense Forces with the subsequent task of fire damage on positions and our forces and assets. The second issue is reconnaissance of movement routes for own units. He monitors this or that area and tries to draw up an optimal route for moving both personnel and equipment, he said. Another task of enemy air reconnaissance is to find routes for safe movement in the nearest enemy rear for the purpose of establishing logistics. — He is trying to find new routes for logistical support activities. Because our FPV drones do not allow us to live peacefully, do not allow us to move peacefully for any purpose - whether for assaults or for delivering provisions or ammunition to advanced positions, the spokesman said. Despite this, the Russians are still trying to use equipment for logistical support and personnel transportation. Defense forces effectively counter such attempts. — Yesterday evening, the enemy tried to bring personnel to Vovchansk with the help of vehicles. But the equipment was discovered, it was damaged and it was partially destroyed along with the crew and the landing party that it was carrying to reinforce units in Vovchansk, Vitaliy Sarantsev reported. Earlier, ArmyInform informed that destruction of enemy reconnaissance UAVs long range is one of the keys to reducing the number of anti-aircraft missile strikes on Ukrainian territory, and also reported that in the area of ​​Aggregatny Zavod in Vovchansk, the enemy hit their own units with anti-aircraft missiles.

Title: The Ministry of Defense implements Euro-Atlantic management standards: specialists have completed jo...
Description: About this inform September 16 in the MoU. Co-governance is a governance model that promotes building strong, coordinated interaction between the civilian leadership of the Ministry and the military command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on issues of decision-making and policy formation. The IOU emphasized that this approach, successfully applied by EU and NATO countries, contributes to bringing Ukraine closer to Euro-Atlantic standards. To implement the new system, the department initiated training courses for employees and servicemen of the Defense Forces . As part of this program, 71 specialists were successfully trained. The MOU noted that the curriculum covers the study of the role of committees, modern approaches to defense management, issues of policy formation, and economic aspects of governance in wartime and postwar times. -The culmination of the training was the practical task of preparing and holding a joint governance committee meeting,- the message reads. The First Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Lieutenant General Ivan Gavryliuk emphasized the importance of these training sessions initiatives. -For the successful implementation of joint governance, it is necessary to train specialists who are familiar with the modern principles of management of decision-making and implementation processes in the system of the Ministry of Defense,- he said he. According to him, these courses provide servicemen and employees of the Ministry of Defense with additional knowledge and skills necessary for further reforming the defense sector. Currently, the management structure within the framework of joint governance in the system of the Ministry of Defense consists of from three levels. At the highest level, there is a Strategic Council chaired by the Minister of Defense, which considers the most important issues. The executive level is represented by committees, each of which is responsible for a specific area of ​​activity. The third level includes auxiliary commissions and working groups that provide support for decision-making. Thanks to the implementation of shared governance, the Ministry of Defense has already taken a number of key decisions, including the creation of the Human Capital Policy and the involvement of recruiting agencies for military recruitment. This indicates the readiness of the department's staff to work effectively under the conditions of the new management system and further improvement of decision-making and implementation processes. The curriculum was developed by specialists of the National Defense University of Ukraine, experts of the international PROTECT project 2 and the School of Government of the National University -Ostroh Academy- on the order of the Department of Military Policy and Strategic Planning of the Ministry of Defense. All participants who successfully completed the course received appropriate certificates. As reported by ArmyInform, also gender advisors in the MOU system passed a two-day training on the topic -International humanitarian law and the role of the Defense Forces of Ukraine in its implementation-.

Title: Since the beginning of September, Russia has used more than 640 martyrs against Ukraine - the Presid...
Description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced this on September 16. -Fortunately, most of them were shot down by our soldiers. We are constantly working to make the Ukrainian air shield more effective. We are strengthening our Air Force, mobile fire groups, all air defense units,- the head of state said. The President reminded that this night the Russian army launched 56 -shahedis-, of which 53 were shot down by Ukrainian air defense units. -Our sky defenders have worked effectively in many regions. Thanks for the accuracy to every soldier,- he emphasized. As reported by ArmyInform, during the week the Russians ->used against Ukraine more than 800 guided aerial bombs, about 30 missiles of various types and almost 300 attack drones.

Title: Russian troops shelled Donetsk region 21 times: one person was killed and injured
Description: This was reported by the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin. 12 private houses were damaged in Kurakhovo, an administrative building in Myrnohrad, and 15 houses in the Novoekonomichny district of Grodivska hromada. In Pokrovsk, 1 person died and 3 others were injured, 3 infrastructure facilities and a household building were damaged. Also in Liman, as a result of Russian aggression, 2 administrative buildings and a non-residential building were destroyed. In Mykolaivka, the occupiers injured 3 people, damaged 11 high-rise buildings, and a shop. In addition, Russian invaders destroyed 10 houses in Siversk. In the Chasovoyarsk community, the enemy wounded one resident. 423 people, including 98 children, were evacuated from the front line. As reported by ArmyInform, last day, in general, the Russian invaders genshtab-zsu/->inflicted on the territory of Ukraine 56 air strikes, dropping 83 guided aerial bombs. The troops of the Russian Federation were involved in destroying 428 kamikaze drones.

Title: Airfields are more important than carriers: the Armed Forces named the main method of combating KAB ...
Description: On the air of the national telethon -Yedini Novyni- the spokesman of OTU -Kharkiv- Vitaly Sarantsev emphasized this. — First of all, of course, it is the destruction of the carriers of these ammunition. This is the first. And the second, more important, I believe, is the destruction of the airfield infrastructure in the range of the weapons that we are now asking from our partners, he said. Strikes on enemy airfields with long-range weapons from Western partners can significantly change the situation for the better for Ukraine. — Destruction of airfield infrastructure, destruction of airstrips, destruction of warehouses with ammunition, warehouses with PMM — this, of course, would greatly improve our situation and greatly weaken the offensive capabilities of the enemy, he explained in detail. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the occupiers hit the Kharkiv region with anti-aircraft guns: one person died in the region, 47 were injured.

Title: The invaders went on an assault, but the marines stopped them with one FPV drone
Description: released a video of the combat work on September 16 on its channel Naval Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. -Just one excellent FPV drone in the skillful hands of the pilot of the Gryphon unit of the 501st separate battalion of the marines stopped another attempt to storm our positions by Katsap bastards,- the military said. Previously, ArmyInform showed how drones of the Gryphon UAV unit of the 501st Marine Infantry Battalion of the Armed Forces of Ukraine punisheda large number of army transport Russian Federation for violating traffic rules.

Title: The Armed Forces explained why the Russians do not dare to attack ships in the grain corridor
Description: This was noted by the spokesman of the Navy of Ukraine, Captain 3rd Rank Dmytro Pletenchuk, on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyni- . — The incident took place outside our grain corridor, our corridor is operating in a stable mode. Most of it, as you know, passes through the territorial waters of the member countries of the North Atlantic Alliance. Accordingly, the Russians do not dare to do such pranks in these waters, he said. In addition, grain carriers usually sail under foreign flags. Among the leaders who use the services of the Ukrainian grain corridor, China is on the first place and Spain is on the second. — We had a similar case last year. Over time, of course, it will become clear whether this was a targeted attack or not. However, this does not change the fact that the Russians targeted a civilian vessel, regardless of whether it was the result of the irresponsible use of inappropriate weapons or a targeted attack, the spokesman emphasized. Russians hit a civilian ship with wheat from Ukraine for Egypt with the Kh-22 Burya anti-ship missile. - This is a rather outdated type of weapon. It is anti-ship, but given that it was immediately designed for a nuclear warhead, an error of 50 kilometers was not a problem for it. But when it is used with another warhead, it can become a problem for it - not only for it, but also for everyone who is in the radius of flight of this missile, Dmytro Pletenchuk noted. He reminded that this missile should be called -50 for 50- - launched more than 50 years ago, it may not hit the target, deflecting at a distance of more than 50 kilometers. The spokesman also noted that the Russians launched a missile from a Tu-22 strategic aviation bomber. -This shows that the Russians do not dare to come close to our coast using tactical aviation,- he emphasized. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that withdrawal of Russian ships from the port of Novorossiysk is connected with the threat of use of long-range weapons by the Defense Forces of Ukraine, which could hit ships at the base's location.

Title: Army sportsmen won gold at the Baltic Championship in shooting
Description: This was reported to ArmyInform by the Department of Physical Culture and Sports of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. In the period from September 12 to 15, 2024, the 3rd Baltic Ball Shooting Championship among military personnel was held in Dobele (Latvia) with the participation of seven European countries (Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia, Poland, Sweden, Switzerland and Ukraine). In total, the national team of the Armed Forces of Ukraine won seven medals, including: 2 gold, 2 silver and 3 bronze. In particular, in the air pistol competition, the men's team of the Armed Forces of Ukraine won the gold award, and the women's – became a silver medalist. In the personal competition in this exercise, representatives of the Training and Sports Base of Summer Sports, senior lieutenant Pavlo Korostylov and senior soldier Polina Kolesnikova won silver and bronze medals, respectively. In the sports pistol competition, the men's team of the Armed Forces of Ukraine won the gold award, and the women's – became a bronze medalist. Senior Lieutenant Pavlo Korostylov won another bronze medal for Ukraine in the individual shooting competition for this exercise and was also nominated for the best marksman at the results of the championship. Earlier ArmyInform reported , that an employee of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Ivanna Berezovska, won two gold medals at the World Sumo Championship.

Title: He spied on mobile air defense groups and the assault brigade -Lyut-: an Odesa citizen was detained
Description: About inform September 16 in the Security Service of Ukraine. It is noted that the priority targets of the enemy were the temporary bases of units of the combined assault brigade of the National Police -Lyut-, which perform tasks on the southern front. Also, the occupiers planned to strike the locations of deployment of mobile air defense fire groups. -In order to obtain geolocations for the attacks, the Russian special service remotely recruited a 63-year-old man from Odessa who agreed to cooperate in exchange for money,- the report said. To carry out enemy tasks, he regularly went around the city, where under the guise of walking, he secretly photographed military objects. -In order to transfer intelligence to the aggressor, the agent used e-mail,- the SBU said. During the search of the detainee's premises, a mobile phone and computer equipment with evidence of criminal activity were seized. -Employees of the SBU documented the intelligence activity of the suspect step by step and arrested him red-handed when he was conducting reconnaissance near a military facility. Additional measures were also taken to secure the bases of Ukrainian troops,- the SBU reported. Investigators of the Security Service informed him of the suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason committed under martial law). The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to life in prison with forfeiture of property. As reported by ArmyInform, previously the SBU and the National Police detained four more accomplices of the Russian special services who -na-10-rokiv-tyurmy/->committed arson attacks in Odesa. Under the -sight- of the enemy were service minibuses and SUVs of the Defense Forces.

Title: The occupiers hit the Kharkiv region with anti-aircraft guns: one person died in the region, 47 were...
Description: informed Oleg Synegubov, chief of Kharkiv OVA, about the consequences of enemy attacks on Kharkiv Oblast during the past day. Yesterday, around 3:30 p.m., the Russian army struck the Nemyshlyansky district of Kharkov with anti-tank missiles. As a result of the shelling, one person died and another 43 people were injured, including 4 children. 22 apartment buildings and 20 cars were damaged. One of the hits of an aerial bomb hit a 12-story residential building. Also, around 4:00 p.m., the Russian military hit Kupyansk with aerial bombs, 3 KAB hits were recorded in the city and 4 on its northern outskirts. Two women and a man were injured. Later, a car was hit by an FPV drone in Kupyansk. In the Kupyan district, the occupiers also shelled the villages of Senkove and Kurylivka of the Kuriliv community and the village of Kindrashivka of the Kindrashiv community. There, as a result of shelling, residential buildings and farm buildings burned, and fires broke out in ecosystems. In the Izyum district, the villages of Pisky-Radkivski and Shykivka of the Boriv community, and the village of Verbivka of the Balakliya community were hit by crows. A 76-year-old woman was injured in Pisky-Radkivskyi, a warehouse was on fire. In Shyykivka, there was a fire in the ecosystem - grass burned on an area of ​​500 square meters. In Verbivka, as a result of the shelling, two farm buildings and grass on an area of ​​10 hectares burned. In the Kharkiv district, the Russian occupiers shelled Circun of the Tsirkuniv community and Ruska Lozova of the Dergachyv community. Two farm buildings, a defunct store, a defunct gas station and grass on an area of ​​7 hectares burned in Tsirkuny. The invaders fired at a store, a hangar, a metal container and an outbuilding. In Ruska Lozovaya, as a result of shelling, a farm and grass on an area of ​​1 hectare burned. The occupiers also shelled the village of Verkhniy Saltiv of the Starosaltiv community of the Chuguyiv district. A house, an outbuilding and grass on an area of ​​10 hectares burned there. In Bohodukhiv Oblast, as a result of enemy shelling outside the village of Stognii of the Zolochiv community, a fire broke out in the ecosystem - grass burned on an area of ​​10 hectares. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the army of the Russian Federation bombed Kharkiv, with time became known about an increasing number of victims.

Title: Night bombers illuminate Luhansk region and force the enemy to retreat
Description: released a video of the combat work of the fighters of the rapid response border command post of RUbAK -Fenix- on their channel. -Our UAV operators continue their tireless work of cleaning our native land from the occupation scum,- defenders of Ukraine commented. Previously, ArmyInform showed how fighters from the Guards Brigade of the -Revenge- offensive during one day destroyed 5 motorcycles with occupiers in Donetsk region and Kharkiv region.

Title: The army of the Russian Federation carried out more than 60 shellings in the north of Ukraine
Description: This is reported by the operational command -North-. -As a result of Russian shelling over the past 24 hours, a residential building, farm buildings, agricultural machinery and private transport were destroyed, residential buildings and critical infrastructure were damaged,- the report said. Pre-No civilian casualties. Information about the destruction, the dead or wounded among the locals is being clarified. As reported by ArmyInform, yesterday the enemy delivered a missile attack on the positions of Ukrainian units and populated areas with the use of one missile, as well as 77 airstrikes, including dropping 117 anti-aircraft missiles.

Title: According to their own units with anti-aircraft missiles: in Vovchansk, the enemy shelled the area o...
Description: Detailed information about the situation and enemy losses in the Kharkiv direction informed in Kharkiv OTU. In Vovchansk, in the evening in the northern part of the city, the enemy made an attempt to deliver personnel with the use of automobile equipment, which was destroyed as a result of fire damage. Due to the double fire damage - both from the Defense Forces and from their own MLRS - the enemy has suffered casualties, is evacuating the wounded and is trying to establish logistical support. In the area of ​​the settlement Tikhe, he brought personnel to advanced positions, focused the main attention on conducting aerial reconnaissance with the aim of identifying units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. In the area of ​​the settlement Hlyboke, the enemy is carrying out individual movement of personnel with the aim of replenishing the current shortage in forward positions, conducting engineering reconnaissance of advance routes. It is trying to find new routes for carrying out logistical support measures. Near Lukyantsi, the enemy is expanding the communication system, has carried out logistical support measures. During the past 24 hours, there has been 1 combat encounter. the Russian occupiers also carried out 2 airstrikes using 6 anti-aircraft missiles. The occupiers struck 36 kamikaze drones and fired 372 shots at the positions of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The defense forces of Ukraine respond adequately to the actions of the enemy and continue to destroy the manpower, weapons and military equipment of the Russian occupiers. Enemy losses over the past day amounted to 85 creatures, of which 22 were irreversible, 61 sanitary. Two occupiers surrendered as prisoners. Also in the Kharkiv direction the enemy lost destroyed and damaged 42 units of weapons and military equipment, in particular: Also in the Kharkiv direction, the Defense Forces destroyed 43 shelters for personnel, a place to store ammunition and 2 launch pads for launching unmanned aerial vehicles. ArmyInform previously explained , which on the occupiers enter their own advanced positions in the north of Kharkiv region only individually and in small groups - the reason is Ukrainian drones.

Title: Our drone destroyed the anti-drone position of the Russians with one hit
Description: They published a video of combat work on their channel. It is noted that the aerial reconnaissance of the 5th Slobozhan Brigade of the NSU detected the positions of the Russian invaders, from which the enemy was conducting anti-drone control of its units. -Given the importance of the target, its coordinates were passed on to our brigade's FPV drone crew. But a decision was made to strike,- the fighters said. According to them, thanks to the professionalism and meticulous work of the Slobozhan crew with the involvement of only one FPV drone, the position of the anti-drone calculation of the Russian invaders was destroyed. Previously, ArmyInform showed how a single kamikaze drone with a cumulative charge accurately hit and destroyed the anti-aircraft missile complex -Tor- of the Russian occupiers, UAV operators of the 5th Slobozhan Brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine.

Title: -From fire to flame-: the Russians made an unpleasant choice in the Black Sea
Description: Such a well-founded assumption was made by the spokesman of the Navy of Ukraine, Captain 3rd rank Dmytro Pletenchuk, . - This may indicate the fact that at some point the Russians felt uneasy at their base of Novorossian and had to choose, as they say in Russia, -from fire to flame,- he said. The occupiers had little choice - either to stay at the base, where they could be hit by Ukrainian long-range weapons, or to go out to sea, where Ukrainian naval drones stalk enemy ships. — As a result, they chose to go out to sea, where they can meet Ukrainian drones. Why did they make this choice? We'll probably find out sometime soon. But most likely, their choice was not very pleasant, the spokesman suggested. Obviously, it became even more dangerous for the occupier ships to stay at the base in Novorossiysk than to go to the open sea. - The tactic of hiding at the Novorossiysk base for the past many months is understandable, because it is easier to organize defense there than in the open sea. Therefore, such a choice leads to similar conclusions, Dmytro Pletenchuk noted. On the other hand, he emphasized, it is hardly possible to claim that going to sea is connected with the possible use of ship-based missile weapons by the Russians. Earlier, ArmyInform explained, what could threaten the mass withdrawal of Russian missile carriers to the Black Sea, and reported that due to logistical problems, the occupiers will increase the transport load on the emergency Crimean Bridge.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , I decree: to start holding a nationwide minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, to be announced in all mass media regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: Russian troops hit two high-rise buildings in the Kherson region
